story:
About Us

  • We are creative, hungry, ambitious, passionate, intuitive, self-sustaining, adventurous and have been pinching pennies to prepare for our first big adventure. 

    We strive to achieve self-sustainability entirely by living out of an RV or van-conversion while rent prices rise and our ideas grow. As much as we work, the vehicle of our dreams exceeds our immediate budget. It needs to survive the length of the US and it ain't cheap. We also strive to show people our age how to live minimally and with a tiny moving footprint.

    How you can help : Any donations are so appreciated. We need to have a backup in case our vehicle breaks down and considering this will be an OLD van or RV, its not unlikely to happen.  

    We can't wait to share our film/video/digital photography with all of our loved ones and whomever wants to follow us for the ride. Everything will be posted on our upcoming .com which will document all of our stops and sites including the good and bad days!


  • Alex and Emilie are a self-taught creative team specializing in portraiture, travel, lifestyle, fashion and sports apparel photography. We also collect organically curated concepts and apply them to unique projects of all kinds.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We understand that this is a huge undertaking for two people without a disposable income. We also understand the risks and challenges that come with driving an old van/RV over 3000 miles. With that said, we need a little cushion in case we break down or have an emergency.
  • We also plan on launching a gallery showing of our photos and stories to accompany them. This will take a little financial support to lock down a space, developing film, printing digital copies, and mounting. 
  • In return for your contributions, we've set up a few donation-based goodies to send to our backers:
    $100 donation : 
    A fabulous medium-sized print from your favorite city/site. Framed and matted. 
    -Albuquerque 
  • -Phoenix 

  • -Austin 
    -Nashville 
    -Atlanta 
    -Memphis 
    -Monterey Bay/Big Sur 
    -The Grand Canyon 
    -And everywhere in between

    Accompanied by an original short story or poem that fits your chosen image written by Emilie St Claire 
    (rareformblackcloud.wordpress.com)

    LIMITED TO FIRST 15 SUPPORTERS :)
    Shipped a month after we've settled in BK!

    Photos posted on our blog which will launch one week before departure.

  • IF we do not reach our goal, the funds will still go towards our journey. Everything helps and not reaching our goal will not be a deterrent to our ultimate destination. 

  • The Impact

  • This adventure is important to the both of us in numerous ways. Alex and I have been working our entire adult lives to make a difference and approach creativity in a very organic attainable way. We do not use pretentious means to do so and the only actual "profit" will be being able to say "we freakin did it!" and to share our experience with others. 
  • We want to show that its possible to take risks and live with a traveling footprint with minimal impact on the environments. 
  • We hope to capture the weird, wonderful, and nostalgic aspects of our country while it still holds those features.  
  • We stand by the process of executing photography with film and even in the digital world. While iPhone photos are on the rapid rise and phone lenses are becoming crazy in terms of quality and resolution, we'd like to stand by the craft in a traditional sense. 
  • Risks & Challenges
  • Risks and challenges come with every passion and adventure.
  • We need to cover the overhead for potential mechanical problems that could lead to needing lodging outside of our new adventure-mobile.
  • We promise not to rip each other's heads off on this trip! 
  • That's about it for risks I suppose! We've got common sense and our wits about us.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign! 
  • Follow our soon-to-be blog/instagram accounts!
  • Visit our photography websites!
  • Take risks and go on an adventure!

About Us

We also strive to show people our age how to live minimally and with a tiny moving footprint.
How you can help : Any donations are so appreciated. We need to have a backup in case our vehicle breaks down and considering this will be an OLD van or RV, its not unlikely to happen.  
We can't wait to share our film/video/digital photography with all of our loved ones and whomever wants to follow us for the ride. Everything will be posted on our upcoming .com which will document all of our stops and sites including the good and bad days!


Alex and Emilie are a self-taught creative team specializing in portraiture, travel, lifestyle, fashion and sports apparel photography. We also collect organically curated concepts and apply them to unique projects of all kinds.
   What We Need & What You Get 
We understand that this is a huge undertaking for two people without a disposable income. We also understand the risks and challenges that come with driving an old van/RV over 3000 miles. With that said, we need a little cushion in case we break down or have an emergency.
We also plan on launching a gallery showing of our photos and stories to accompany them. This will take a little financial support to lock down a space, developing film, printing digital copies, and mounting. 
In return for your contributions, we've set up a few donation-based goodies to send to our backers:$100 donation : A fabulous medium-sized print from your favorite city/site. Framed and matted. -Albuquerque 

-Phoenix 

-Austin -Nashville -Atlanta -Memphis -Monterey Bay/Big Sur -The Grand Canyon -And everywhere in between
Accompanied by an original short story or poem that fits your chosen image written by Emilie St Claire (rareformblackcloud.wordpress.com)
LIMITED TO FIRST 15 SUPPORTERS :)Shipped a month after we've settled in BK!
Photos posted on our blog which will launch one week before departure.

IF we do not reach our goal, the funds will still go towards our journey. Everything helps and not reaching our goal will not be a deterrent to our ultimate destination. 
The Impact

 
This adventure is important to the both of us in numerous ways. Alex and I have been working our entire adult lives to make a difference and approach creativity in a very organic attainable way. We do not use pretentious means to do so and the only actual "profit" will be being able to say "we freakin did it!" and to share our experience with others. 
We want to show that its possible to take risks and live with a traveling footprint with minimal impact on the environments. 
We hope to capture the weird, wonderful, and nostalgic aspects of our country while it still holds those features.  
We stand by the process of executing photography with film and even in the digital world. While iPhone photos are on the rapid rise and phone lenses are becoming crazy in terms of quality and resolution, we'd like to stand by the craft in a traditional sense. 
Risks & Challenges
Risks and challenges come with every passion and adventure.
We need to cover the overhead for potential mechanical problems that could lead to needing lodging outside of our new adventure-mobile.
We promise not to rip each other's heads off on this trip! 
That's about it for risks I suppose! We've got common sense and our wits about us.

  Other Ways You Can Help 

Please share this campaign! 

Follow our soon-to-be blog/instagram accounts!
Visit our photography websites!
Take risks and go on an adventure!

story:
My Vision

is to provide my services with the high end BiAxis QS Medical Laser throughout Europe to studios that are interested in expanding their product range in laser removal solutions. The Laserklinik idea is a perfect addition to tattoo and cosmetic studios that have not specialized in laser treatments. My area of expertise is tattoo and age spot removals as well as hyperpigmentation removals. Additional treatments can be offered depending on the countries legislation.
There are few providers that are specialized in laser removals only, and those are usually permanently situated. With this business idea you get a laser expert that has not only a mobile set up but is also willing to offer her services to a vide range of studios in Europe that are interested in a collaboration.





My Goal

is to work with a variety of tattoo and cosmetic studios and expanding my current network in Europe. Offering tattoo, age spots and hyperpigmentation removal with the highest laser quality existing at the moment.





Waht I Need

With your donation the new tattoo removal solution with Laserklinik will purchase

medical items for treatments,

a travel safety box and a new car (incl. insurance). In order to protect the laser a tailor made safety box has to be installed in the car.

Furthermore investments will be made for marketing and product promotion,

laser maintenance,

continuing professional training

travel expenses.

Total amount 35’000 €

      

     


    My Personal Effected Investment

     

    include 55’000 €

    including the BiAxis QS Medical Laser

    a second hand car

    a mobile safety box to transport the laser 



    What I Already Have Reached


    different tattoo and cosmetic locations where a collaboration has already been established. Further cooperation with tattoo studios in Germany are planed to be implemented in August 2016.

story:
Roam or rediscover Downtown Sydney with 32 Spokes, a seasonal microbusiness designed to add vitality, increase outdoor activity, and provide creative transport.

OUR STORY:

Hello, Heather here, co-creator of 32 Spokes. 

First, I must admit, my pedal powered friend, "Sue," is something of an exhibitionist. 

She's blue and bold, and maintains quite a presence. I’ll be pedalling along, and through my ear buds, I’ll hear a horn honk, or someone will throw me a thumbs-up out the passenger window. She's a smile magnet, and spending a day roaming with her in the sunshine is pretty special. 

I want to share that novel, carefree experience with others.

En route to the Sydney Boardwalk recently for a UIT (Uhma Institute of Technology) photo shoot, we were met with, "Where can I get one of those?" and "Cool ride, can I try?" by visitors from the docked cruise ship. Ally and her husband Mick from Queensland, Australia, featured below, were among them. The initial idea for 32 Spokes - a bike rental stand that offers low impact trikes and bike cruisers - emerged from conversations I had that day with curious passerbys and subsequent promising chats with other prospective customers, neighbors, friends, and community development champions.

Since then, I've been giving alot more thought to the practical, cultural, and environmental benefits of establishing a bike rental stand. Many people have offered their suggestions to shape the experience. I'm encouraged by their enthusiasm.

THE POSSIBILITIES:

To enhance the discovery experience by bike, a UIT cohort is developing a companion audio tour app. A bike sharing program and app is also being considered. Other friends have recommended the addition of pedal powered fun boats, colourful kites, picnic games, chess tables, and radio controlled model sailboats. I also envision providing specialty frozen fruit drinks, lemonade, and some retail. Unique twighlight events this summer are also in the works. I hope to partner with existing providers to offer beginner level kayaking and stand-up paddleboarding lessons that could be fun for cruise line passengers with a few hours to spare. I also hope to host an outdoor recreation gear swap for local islanders. Additionally, as a fan of innovations that have the potential to enrichen and extend recreation and fitness rituals to capture valuable data, I also envison carving out a spot for a recreational tech (RecTech) hub where leisure and technology intersect. 

The possibilities are endless and exciting. I invite YOU to be a part of shaping and realizing the 32 Spokes vision.

WHAT'S NEXT:

In order to fast track the concept and launch the initial, lean phase of the experiment, this season, I'm reaching out to the community to raise a portion of the monetary startup support necessary to rollout by the end of June, 2015. I've secured an interim location with our partners at the Sydney Port Corporation eager to help us advance 32 Spokes.

Contributions secured from this campaign will secure low impact, cruiser trikes & cycles, bike locks, bike tracking devices, and Yakay helmets suitable for old and young alike. Funds raised will also offset the production cost of sponsorship/wayfinding signage, secure liability insurance, and support costs associated with local and regional partnership development. Any surplus raised beyond the initial goal will be allocated for the procurement of a portable POS system and make potential expansion of services and the addition of part-time employees possible more quickly, too.

To make it happen, I'm hoping to identify 10 sponsors willing to contribute $550 each, garnering "Handlebar Headliner" sponsorship status. This status qualifies contributing organizations and individuals prominent presence on signage affixed to the baskets of each trike/bike and at the rental stand, along with an endless supply of high-fives and smiles from one very grateful proprietor. I've also curated some additional perks for those that would like to make a contribution of a smaller denomination. If you cannot contribute funds, you can still help create and champion 32 Spokes. Please consider becoming a "Spokesperson" by sharing this campaign link with your social and professional networks by using the IndieGoGo sharing tools.

PERKS:

"From 0-10 km p/hr in over 60 minutes," 32 Spokes is part of the #slowbicyclemovement. Roam, and enjoy the ride with these fun, bike themed campaign perks provided in that casual spirit. See details on all items in the column to the right of your screen. 

Here's a glimpse.


OTHER DETAILS, TRIVIA & ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS:

- If the minimum amount necessary to fund and launch the project this season is not raised, all contributions will be returned to contributors less any processing or crowdsourcing commission fees (which increase to 9% if the campaign goal is not reached or exceeded). Perks will not be delivered if goal isn't met and contributions are refunded to all respective contributors. Contributors will b 

- I have been documenting the process of planning and launching 32 Spokes. I intend to share the candid videos highlighting my experience and collaborations to provide insight to other local, apsiring micropreneurs.

- 32 Spokes is a seasonal venture that will help me creatively "bootstrap" the development of my tech startup, Benefactory.

- "32 Spokes," comes from the number of spokes on a 32" bike wheel; represents the number of months I've been exploring Canada; is a mathmatically "happy number;" and is a not so subtle reminder to revel in the short but glorious CBI spring/summer season (32, as you may know,  is the freezing point of water at sea level in degrees Farenheit).

- Press release can be accessed at: http://hypertasker.com/2015/06/03/32-spokes/

High fives and immense thanks to the following for directly (or indirectly) shaping the 32 Spokes concept along my recent journey in Cape Breton: Gavin Uhma, Mike Oulette, Mike Targett, Rob Myers, Matt Stewart, Danielle Patterson, Michael Rudderham, Darren MacDonald, Colin McInnis, Faye MacDonald, Darian MacDonald, Brian Best, Carol Louie, Matt Johnston, Emily Macleod, AJ Fraser, Jake Florian, Seonaid Lee, Dr. David Rae, Alan Fraser, David B. Wheeler, Permjot Valia, Boby Pelley, Keith MacDonald, Derek Mombourquette, Parker Donham, Lori Kennedy, Chantelle Cormier, Nadine Lefort, Jill McPherson, Krista McNeil, Darcy Campbell, Rossi McInnes, Michael Orr, Lilly Orr, Delila Voyles, Alexis Rudderham, Rob Carmichael, Kevin Mcinnis, Damien Barry, Vern Macdonald.

Organizational Partners & Facilitators: UIT, Sydney Port Corporation, Frameworks, Cape Breton Partnership, Cape Breton University, Startup Cape Breton, Sampson-McDougall, TEDxCapeBreton.

Immense Thanks!

32 Spokes Cape Breton. Roam. #bikenamedsue
story_txt:
Roam or rediscover Downtown Sydney with 32 Spokes, a seasonal microbusiness designed to add vitality, increase outdoor activity, and provide creative transport.OUR STORY:
Hello, Heather here, co-creator of 32 Spokes. 
First, I must admit, my pedal powered friend, "Sue," is something of an exhibitionist. She's blue and bold, and maintains quite a presence. I’ll be pedalling along, and through my ear buds, I’ll hear a horn honk, or someone will throw me a thumbs-up out the passenger window. She's a smile magnet, and spending a day roaming with her in the sunshine is pretty special. I want to share that novel, carefree experience with others.
En route to the Sydney Boardwalk recently for a UIT (Uhma Institute of Technology) photo shoot, we were met with, "Where can I get one of those?" and "Cool ride, can I try?" by visitors from the docked cruise ship. Ally and her husband Mick from Queensland, Australia, featured below, were among them. The initial idea for 32 Spokes - a bike rental stand that offers low impact trikes and bike cruisers - emerged from conversations I had that day with curious passerbys and subsequent promising chats with other prospective customers, neighbors, friends, and community development champions.

Since then, I've been giving alot more thought to the practical, cultural, and environmental benefits of establishing a bike rental stand. Many people have offered their suggestions to shape the experience. I'm encouraged by their enthusiasm.THE POSSIBILITIES:
To enhance the discovery experience by bike, a UIT cohort is developing a companion audio tour app. A bike sharing program and app is also being considered. Other friends have recommended the addition of pedal powered fun boats, colourful kites, picnic games, chess tables, and radio controlled model sailboats. I also envision providing specialty frozen fruit drinks, lemonade, and some retail. Unique twighlight events this summer are also in the works. I hope to partner with existing providers to offer beginner level kayaking and stand-up paddleboarding lessons that could be fun for cruise line passengers with a few hours to spare. I also hope to host an outdoor recreation gear swap for local islanders. Additionally, as a fan of innovations that have the potential to enrichen and extend recreation and fitness rituals to capture valuable data, I also envison carving out a spot for a recreational tech (RecTech) hub where leisure and technology intersect. 
The possibilities are endless and exciting. I invite YOU to be a part of shaping and realizing the 32 Spokes vision.
WHAT'S NEXT:In order to fast track the concept and launch the initial, lean phase of the experiment, this season, I'm reaching out to the community to raise a portion of the monetary startup support necessary to rollout by the end of June, 2015. I've secured an interim location with our partners at the Sydney Port Corporation eager to help us advance 32 Spokes.
Contributions secured from this campaign will secure low impact, cruiser trikes & cycles, bike locks, bike tracking devices, and Yakay helmets suitable for old and young alike. Funds raised will also offset the production cost of sponsorship/wayfinding signage, secure liability insurance, and support costs associated with local and regional partnership development. Any surplus raised beyond the initial goal will be allocated for the procurement of a portable POS system and make potential expansion of services and the addition of part-time employees possible more quickly, too.
To make it happen, I'm hoping to identify 10 sponsors willing to contribute $550 each, garnering "Handlebar Headliner" sponsorship status. This status qualifies contributing organizations and individuals prominent presence on signage affixed to the baskets of each trike/bike and at the rental stand, along with an endless supply of high-fives and smiles from one very grateful proprietor. I've also curated some additional perks for those that would like to make a contribution of a smaller denomination. If you cannot contribute funds, you can still help create and champion 32 Spokes. Please consider becoming a "Spokesperson" by sharing this campaign link with your social and professional networks by using the IndieGoGo sharing tools.
PERKS:"From 0-10 km p/hr in over 60 minutes," 32 Spokes is part of the #slowbicyclemovement. Roam, and enjoy the ride with these fun, bike themed campaign perks provided in that casual spirit. See details on all items in the column to the right of your screen. Here's a glimpse.OTHER DETAILS, TRIVIA & ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS:
- If the minimum amount necessary to fund and launch the project this season is not raised, all contributions will be returned to contributors less any processing or crowdsourcing commission fees (which increase to 9% if the campaign goal is not reached or exceeded). Perks will not be delivered if goal isn't met and contributions are refunded to all respective contributors. Contributors will b 
- I have been documenting the process of planning and launching 32 Spokes. I intend to share the candid videos highlighting my experience and collaborations to provide insight to other local, apsiring micropreneurs.
- 32 Spokes is a seasonal venture that will help me creatively "bootstrap" the development of my tech startup, Benefactory.
- "32 Spokes," comes from the number of spokes on a 32" bike wheel; represents the number of months I've been exploring Canada; is a mathmatically "happy number;" and is a not so subtle reminder to revel in the short but glorious CBI spring/summer season (32, as you may know,  is the freezing point of water at sea level in degrees Farenheit).- Press release can be accessed at: http://hypertasker.com/2015/06/03/32-spokes/
High fives and immense thanks to the following for directly (or indirectly) shaping the 32 Spokes concept along my recent journey in Cape Breton: Gavin Uhma, Mike Oulette, Mike Targett, Rob Myers, Matt Stewart, Danielle Patterson, Michael Rudderham, Darren MacDonald, Colin McInnis, Faye MacDonald, Darian MacDonald, Brian Best, Carol Louie, Matt Johnston, Emily Macleod, AJ Fraser, Jake Florian, Seonaid Lee, Dr. David Rae, Alan Fraser, David B. Wheeler, Permjot Valia, Boby Pelley, Keith MacDonald, Derek Mombourquette, Parker Donham, Lori Kennedy, Chantelle Cormier, Nadine Lefort, Jill McPherson, Krista McNeil, Darcy Campbell, Rossi McInnes, Michael Orr, Lilly Orr, Delila Voyles, Alexis Rudderham, Rob Carmichael, Kevin Mcinnis, Damien Barry, Vern Macdonald.
Organizational Partners & Facilitators: UIT, Sydney Port Corporation, Frameworks, Cape Breton Partnership, Cape Breton University, Startup Cape Breton, Sampson-McDougall, TEDxCapeBreton.Immense Thanks!32 Spokes Cape Breton. Roam. #bikenamedsue

story:
Providing service to the community is all we do...

Due to the fact that our department is all-volunteer, each of our members have their own full-time job to support themselves and their families, and then donate whatever time they have to the fire department. Our dedicated members must leave work and their home life when summoned to an emergency.  As you know -
seconds count in an emergency, and your donation will make the difference in promoting around-the-clock staffing of our volunteer fire department, which eliminates the need for firemen to drive from their homes to the station to get trucks on the roads. This removes critical time from emergency response to incidents and, in most cases, will reduce our response times to less than a minute.


Our Goal:

Over time, we are planning to improve our facilities to better accommodate life at the firehouse. We are using very limited funds from our general budget as the majority of this money must remain available for the purchase of fire equipment and other necessary supplies. The objective is to increase the initiative to have constant volunteer staffing within our four walls which will, in turn, reduce response times to emergencies, allowing us to provide better and faster service to our residents in time of need. 


How to Help:

We are soliciting the help of our community to assist with costs of building this new program due to our limited available funds for this project. Projects will include the remodeling of areas within the station to create comfortable lounges, installing shower facilities, upgrading our bathrooms, upgrading our kitchen area and adding a modest climate control system.



Who benefits?

This program will not only improve the quality of service we can provide to our residents, it will also provide room and board for members. For example, college students who attend nearby institutions such as Muhlenberg and Cedar Crest colleges would benefit greatly as they would be provided with room to board for their college semesters in return for their volunteer service as a firefighter. 


Thank you.

We view this investment in our property and our members very highly - just as we view the safety of our community. If you cannot make a contribution, spreading the word about our program is just as helpful. Any amount of a donation would be sincerely appreciated and immediately applied, with our humble gratitude, to our mission of keeping South Whitehall and the surrounding communities safe.

story:
The ConnectScale and accompanying mobile app delivers a new fish scale and logging system that any serious angler must have.

Gone are the tales of “the big fish” without proof or the days of losing precious fishing time by weighing your catch and logging the data manually. The ConnectScale’s technology creates an entirely new way to record your fishing data and increase your fishing success.

 “My hope is to provide an innovative product that both professional and recreational anglers alike can use to capture catch data that will ultimately improve their fishing results.” -  Ben Arnold (founder)

How it works

Weigh the fish with the use of the Bluetooth® enabled digital scale and with each fish weighed the weight, time, date, temperature, and GPS location is automatically saved and tracked via the mobile app.  Snap a quick picture with you mobile device and if you choose release the catch or place him in your live well.  Once the catch is safely released, other relevant information such as length, species, bait/lure, and fishing technique is available so that you can capture other important details for easy tracking and sharing.  With social media compatibility, the ConnectScale will transform the way you share your fishing experiences with friends. (For anglers who want to keep secret spots private from other anglers, the GPS information is able to be set to private mode.) 

Key Features

The ConnectScale-


The App-

1)  Automatic data log of critical fishing information (weight, GPS, time, date, and temperature).2)  Ability to log additional data log including lure type, species, length, water temperature, fishing technique, waterway, and catch and release information. 

3)  Snap a photo and save a picture of your catch too! 

4)  Secure Login with full social media compatibility (Twitter and Facebook) to share your catches with one touch.

5)  Complete Cloud storage functionality allows log in and use via any network capable device with the app installed.

6)  Easy to access a summary of your catch history such as average catch, total weight, and amount of fish caught by lure type, waterway, and species.

Product Roadmap and Use of Funds

We started developing the scale in October 2014 and were able complete a working prototype and test app in February 2015.   The funds we have already raised have been used to develop our prototype scale and Bluetooth test app, design elements of our app, and development of apps for both an iOS and Android devices.  

We are now at the point were we need the fishing and Indiegogo community to help us bring the ConnectScale to market.  We are fully committed to this product and have selected Flexible funding to help fund the remaining steps.  The funds raised from this Indiegogo campaign will be used towards the product’s Bluetooth SIG qualification, FCC & CE testing and certifications, as well as our minimum production order.   


What does the future hold?

 Our initial focus is growth in the US and Canada, but as our product success grows we have plans to expand into key international markets such as Europe, Australia, and Asia.

We also have plans for many more features, but the speed to market of these features depends on the support funds we gain for the project. Further innovations and app updates include:

-Fishing tournament integration. The ConnectScale technology will let even the smallest fishing tournaments have live leaderboards and fast scoring.

-Additional tools that help anglers learn success patterns such as more detailed weather information and automatically updating lunar tables.

-ConnectScale Saltwater model for a scale that can handle larger weight capacity and tough enough to endure the rigors at sea.

-Expansion into more countries starting with Europe and Australia

Although our goal is to raise at least $25,000, the more money we raise, the more features we'll be able to add to the app. 


ConnectScale Referral Program

START SHARING WITH FRIENDS, FAMILY, & FISHING BUDDIES

WANT TO EARN SOME EXTRA $$$?  Contribute any amount and then start sharing your unique URL link with your Friends, Family, & Fishing Buddies.   You will earn $5 cash back for every contribution where someone purchases an individual unit Perk.  So if you refer 5 people that then contribute and purchase a individual unit perk level you will get $25 cash back.   In addition if you refer someone and they purchase the bundle perk, then you will get $50 cash back.    
Here is how it works: 

Step 1:  

Log In to your Indiegogo account if you have not already.  You may sign up if you haven't.  

Make sure you have made your own contribution of any amount or perk if you have not already.  

Step 2:  

Copy and paste your unique link URL and send via email or share on any social media site.   You can also use the buttons to share your unique URL.  

Step 3:

Monitor and track the progress of your referrals.  Here is a LINK explaining how to participate in a referral campaign.   

Payouts for the cash back referral program will occur at the end of the campaign.  So, in summary, if you have made a contribution of any amount we will offer a cash back payment of $5 for each individual perk and $50 for each bundle package perk that one of your referrals have contributed to.   So if you refer 100 of your friends and they all purchase an individual unit you could make $500.  If you refer 10 people and they all contribute and purchase the bundle package you could make $500.  We will offer the cash back reward via PayPal so if you paid for your contribution with a credit card we will get in touch with you to obtain your PayPal info and will provide instructions on how to set up a PayPal account if you don't already have one so that we can give you your reward.    

If you have any additional questions about the referral campaign please email us at info@connectscale.com


How ConnectScale began

ConnectScale Founder Ben Arnold is a MBA graduate of the University of Tennessee and has over 10+ years professional experience in Consulting, Data Analytics, Process Improvement, and Technology Program Management.  Drawing on years of experience during his professional career, education, as well as his own fishing experience, Ben came up with the idea of the ConnectScale one day when he was logging into an online dashboard that tracked his family’s weight using a wireless weight scale in his bathroom.  He started to wonder if this technology had been implemented in fishing.  After performing some research and finding that there was nothing currently available, Ben started think of the application.  The idea started to grow when Ben noticed that his cousin, Travis Ketron, a ConnectScale team member, was posting information about his fishing tournaments on Facebook.  

Travis is a member of a local bass fishing club and participates in several regional tournaments throughout the year.  Ben would see pictures that Travis was posting on Social Media of his tournament results that were hand written pages.   

Ben’s background in technology and process improvement led him to think that there has to be a better way to do this.  And that is how the ConnectScale idea was born.

The world’s best way to keep track of your fishing success is almost here! With a little help from you, we can make the ConnectScale a reality. Become a backer today and be the first of your fishing buddies to have the coolest new fishing scale there is. With the ConnectScale in your back pocket, you will be able to spend more time with your line in the water and that equals more fish!

Risk and Challenges

Please note that our product is pending Bluetooth SIG Qualification and FCC/CE Certifications.  We are working with a BQE (Bluetooth Qualification Expert) and have every reason to believe we will receive both qualification and certifications required. 

If you want to help make the ConnectScale a reality, support this project today! Be a part of the group that makes this product a success as your donation will help revolutionize the future of how fish are weighed, logged, and shared!

story:
The Caribbean islands are known for olive sunshine, spicy foods, Calypso, and lots of festivals!
 
Do you want to know about local festivals and musical events happening in the Caribbean before you have even landed? 

Well search no more! Now you can have all this information at your fingertips simply by downloading the app KRIBBEAN on your iOS phone.

Your visit to the Caribbean would not be complete without enjoying the true flavour of places like Jamaica, Haiti, Trinidad & Tobago, Barbuda, Grenada, Barbados, St Vincent & the Grenadines, Martinique, Guyane, BVI, Anguilla, The Bahamas, St Marteen, Curacao, Belize, Montserrat, Guadeloupe..!
 
Get the real travel experience with KRIBBEAN events and music!

The app KRIBBEAN will not only tell you about festivals and concerts but will also cover a wide array of diversified events like Boat parties, Parades, Carnivals…and much more!
 
In short, this simple app will keep you updated on all Caribbean events, always with the latest info.

It will take only a few minutes to get the app downloaded on your iOS device. However, before you download the app check out its user friendly features:

• Find all your favourite entertainment in one place,
• It’s easy: you can save events that you wish to attend in your schedule and it is super-fast too,
• You will get direct links to the music store where you can purchase your favorite songs or albums,
• You will have access to all events happening in the Caribbean and you can personalise your search according to your preferences,
• Sorting facility: you can organize the list in accordance with your preferences,
• Value added services: easy access to contact info, and related website content will be available at your fingertips

The prime motivation behind this user friendly app KRIBBEAN is to nurture the awareness of Caribbean festivals and Caribbean music worldwide. The app will not only enhance the traveling pleasure of visitors, but local people will also get detailed info on various events, concerts and shows with ease!

 

MORE THAN 5000 DOWNLOADS SINCE ITS LAUNCHED ON IPHONE

 

IPHONE.KRIBBEAN.COM

MORE THAN AN APP...

WE'RE PROMOTING THE CARIBBEAN OVER THE SEAS

Thanks to the KRIBBEAN App and our solutions, local artists who are endevouring to promote their music will be able to reach a bigger audience and event organisers will benefit from large-scale communication.

NEWS.KRIBBEAN.COM

A weekly webzine to keep you updated about Caribbean news, events and music.

 

INTERVIEWS, REVIEWS

& PRESS RELEASE

Interviews and artists spotlight.

 

NEWSLETTER

Our newsletter is sent to more than 23 locations.

 

TEAM

 

 

WE NEED YOU!

Thanks to your additional funding, at last we'll be able to bring the app to the ANDROID platform. What's involved:

  • DESIGN (100 HOURS)
  • DEVELOPMENT (350 HOURS)

+ Web application / backend system :

  • DESIGN - DEVELOPMENT (550 HOURS)

This step is crucial to take KRIBBEAN to the next level. Within the web application and the backend system we'll be able to collect useful data for artists, event organisers and tourism organisations.

+ Web application / backend system :DESIGN - DEVELOPMENT (550 HOURS)This step is crucial to take KRIBBEAN to the next level. Within the web application and the backend system we'll be able to collect useful data for artists, event organisers and tourism organisations.

story:
Pre-orders of the book are open until end of November.

 

Click on the red tab & make your order.

 

 

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Who we are & what this book is about

 

The Pin Project is a self-funded travel project with a final goal to travel around the world with our own home registered vehicle(s) -wherever it’s possible- without any time restrictions. It literally defines our travels as Nikos & Georgia. We left from Greece on the 29th of April, 2012 and we are traveliving non-stop since then. We have crossed 45+ countries in Europe, Africa & the Americas covering roughly 100.000 kms in two different vehicles BUT most important, we have experienced a unique mix of kindness & hospitality that fuels our trip and motivates us to carry on.

After such a long time on the road, we decided to make this kind of contribution to the long-standing travellers community and our only intention is to help as many people possible to think out of the box, do romantic and memorable things, realize their dream of travelling around the world, get prepared for this and see what they can get out of it.

By planting this little seed, we want to grow a pine tree rather than an apple tree. It’s all about the shade, not the “fruits” and here is why we need your help to make it happen.

You are invited to be part of publishing & distributing traveliving | a romantic & practical guide hardcopy, the first comprehensive self-pubished book -written while travelling- that talks about all the aspects of long-time, slow travelling around the world.  How we took the decision to get rid of our comfort zone, why we decided to redeem our freedom with a RTW trip, how we got prepared and how we feel after 5 years on the roads of the world.

 

Below, you can see the table of contents of the eBook which has been already published and know exactly what to anticipate:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

More info about the Pin Project at thepinproject.eu & thepinproject.eu/traveliving-a-romantic-practical-guide.

story:
HANERYG 8W SOLAR CHARGER

THE THINNEST AND GREENEST PORTABLE SOLAR CHARGER.

HANERGY 8W SOLAR CHARGER IS THE WORLD'S THINNEST 
AND GREENEST SOLAR CHARGING PRODUCTS

 

Hanergy 8W solar charger , the most portable and efficient solar charging products，produced with the most advanced thin film CIGS solar cell. And the whole production has really reached zero pollution. MiaSolé is the world record holder of flexible CIGS module efficiency, the efficiency of its module which is made by multiple elements sputtering method could reach 17.3%. 

 

 

Hanergy 8W solar charger could still power your device even in the shade or partially blocked. The amorphous silicon technology brings this advantage to it. The high quality solar cells which are made in USA and advanced packaging technology could assure the quality and performance of the Hanergy 8W solar charger. You needn’t worry about this anymore.

 

Built with advanced packaging technology and flexible solar cell thinner than 1mm, the Hanergy 8W solar charger could provide abundant and stable electricity to your device. Its weight is only 160g similar with the weight of one smart phone.

 

Hanergy 8W solar charger could still offer stable electricity between -4°F and 122°F. Excellent waterproof property make the clean and upkeep much more easily. Packaged with ETFE membrane, it show better performance on the waterproof and dustproof. Less covered dust means more energy could be produced. The pitted surface could reduce the sunshine waste caused by the diffuse reflection. More 25% solar energy could be absorbed by the solar cell. The plug could protect the solar charger paper from water and dust.

 

The intelligence USB interface could protect your device during the whole charge progress. You could use it to charge your smart phone and electric devices under the strong sunshine. Your power bank or lithium battery could be still charged under the poor sunshine. You could see the better performance of it in the poor sunshine and no worry about the safety during the charge progress.

 

It could provide you with more safe, green and convenient charge experience. Pollution and battery explosion caused by sun exposure could be avoided by abandoning the lithium-ion battery. And you will never worry about the overweight, consignment and airport check. Your trip will be more safe and convenient.













 

Unique designed hooks will be more convenient for your usage. You could obtain clean energy from Hanergy 8w solar charger by hanging it on your bag.

USAGE SCENARIOS

 

Whether walking or sitting, you could enjoy the stable solar power under the sunshine at anytime and anywhere.









 

DIMENSION

 

SPECIFICATION

 

Model Number :

SP-08

 

Chip :

Miasole

 

Maximum power :

8.0W

 

Output voltage :

5V / 1A

 

Size :

400X256X15mm（including USB interface）

 

Weight :

160g

 

Climbing hooks :

4个

 

Output Interface:

USB

 

Color :

Black , Red , Camouflage

 

 

DEVELOPMENT/ TIMELINE

 

Product concept be proposed on May 2016, Trial-manufacture model be finished on September 2016, Product test on October 2016, Crowdfunding on January 2017, Volume production at February 2017, Delivery on March 2017

ABOUT US AND THE TEAM

 

 



WE NEED YOUR HELP!

 

1、Please visit our shop on Alibaba.

 
2、Please follow our facebook and youtube.

3、It’s a big challenge to develop the cutting edge technology. Lots of time and energy will be cost. Only with your support, could we meet the factory’s minimum order quantities. The Hanergy plant which located in China will produce our product. It has a good operation system of production and quality control. Meanwhile, it also produced the MiaSolé and GSE flexible solar panel.

Current Progress: We have finished the test work of the original solar charger. On the whole, it is awesome and has reached all the technical requirement of massive production.

Manufacturing Production Plan: In order to produce the charger on time, we need plenty of money to purchase solar cell, packaging materials, USB interface in advance. Each of penny gathered from Indiegogo platform will be used to achieve the massive production and final design of our product.

4、As rewards, your next adventure will be more interesting and exciting with our product. The special price will be offered only to the indiedogo backers who order our product at this time.  More than 30% savings will be offered by skipping the dealers and resellers. The product will be send to your house directly from us. Your order means a lot to the trend of solar charge product.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

 

The biggest risk comes from the mass production process. Most attention will be paid on the quality control. We could understand that indiegogo sponsors want to get their products as soon as possible. According to the production capacity and production plan of the plant, the products will be sent to you as soon as possible after the production completion. According to our experience, the Pre-trial products may be slightly different with the products of mass production.

DISTRIBUTOR RECRUITMENT

 

Do you want to be Hanergy distributor or reseller?

If you want purchase our product by batch or want become our distributor, please send email to zhangkun01@hanergy.com to get more information.

 

FAQ

Q1. Why choose US?

*Use best quality materials to ensure the product quality.

*Provide professional person to communicate with you before the order.

*Provide good after-sales service.

*Our plant is professional manufacturer with well-equipped testing facilities and strong technical force.

Q2: Is your goods the lowest price?

EXW Beijing price, we are much cheaper than other suppliers at the same quality.

Q3: What can purchasers do if the solar charger paper has problem?

The offered solar charger paper has one-year warranty. If they do have quality-related problems, please tell us immediately in order for replacement or repairing. We will try our best to make you pleased. All returned items MUST BE in the original condition and packaging with all components and accessories included. If a replacement is not available, then a refund will be issued with the original payment method.

Q4: What is the packaging?

A: We provide neutral packaging

Q5: How should i use it properly?

1.The sun does not always strike it straight on and we can't count on getting the full peak watts all day. Early in the morning and late at night solar panels have a much reduced output with maximum output near noon.

2. Some devices may not charge directly from this panel due to weather conditions or limitations of your device. If you are having trouble, m ake sure the panel is in bright sunlight angled directly at the sun.

3. It is recommended to use this solar panel together with a rechargeable battery so the power generated by the solar panel can be saved and stored.

 

Q6: Can I order the Hanergy 8w solar charger even though i do not live in China?

A: Yes, we ship the Hanergy 8w solar charger worldwide by DHL

Q7: When is Hanergy 8w solar charger expected to ship?

A: Hanergy 8w solar charger is expected to ship from March. We have already placed the order for the first batch of Hanergy 8w solar charger for Indiegogo backers with our manufacturer.

story:
Me aventuré a venir a Europa con una maleta, con la idea de recorrer los países nórdicos. Poder documentar a través de las imágenes cómo se vive, la comida típica, las costumbres de estos países durante la época navideña, que por cuestiones culturales celebramos en el mundo. A pesar que en mi ciudad, (Chiclayo –Perú) en diciembre, sea verano con más de 30 grados; tomamos chocolate caliente y siempre hay algún santa Claus en la calle con un traje hecho para estar en el polo norte. 

I am Jaisia ​​Figueroa, a tireless traveler and lover of photography. I like cinema and my dream is to live doing what I like. I travelled around Europe with a suitcase, with the idea of ​​visiting the Scandinavian Countries. My aim was to document through images how the locals live, their typical food and their traditions during the Christmas season, celebrated all over the world. For example, in my city (Chiclayo -Peru) despite of the temperature of 30 degrees during December, we drink hot chocolate and there is always some Santa Claus in the street dressed up as we was in the North Pole. 

In Peru there is not that much known about the Scandinavian countries, hence, I want to use my images to make people aware of the beauty of those countries and encourage encourage them to travel to make postcards from Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland and Iceland during the Christmas season.

Muy poco se conoce sobre los países nórdicos en Perú, quiero a través de imágenes contar historias que animen a otras personas a viajar y poder hacer postales de Dinamarca, Suecia, Noruega, Finlandia e Islandia, durante la época de navidad.

Mi proyecto fotográfico necesita de tu ayuda para poder terminarlo, quiero compartir cada paso y lugar nuevo que recorro; pues hoy soy yo, pero mañana serás tú, quien se encuentre fuera de casa y busque crear su propio trabajo para ganar un poco de dinero y no dejar las cosas a la mitad.

Quisiera poder realizar una exposición donde pueda vender algunas fotografías que puedas poner en tu casa y/o postales que puedas compartir con otras personas e incluso un souvenir de alguno de estos lugares que siempre puedas llevar contigo. Te aseguro que siempre habrá una historia detrás que podamos compartir y con ese dinero me gustaría poder realizar talleres de fotografía para niños de escasos recursos de Chiclayo, Perú, facilitarles y enseñarles a usar una cámara para contar sus propias historias. Pienso que todo lo que uno hace en la vida cobra sentido cuando lo comparte.

My photographic project needs your help in order to finish it, I want to share every step and new place I go through; Today it is me the one who is away from home and seek to create his own work to earn some money and not leave the project uncompleted, but tomorrow it may be you!

I would like to organize an exhibition where I can sell some photographs that you can put in your house or collect as postcard or souvenir to carry with you. I assure you that there will always be a story behind every picture to share.

My dream is to use the money collected to run photography workshops for children belonged to low-income communities in Chiclayo, Peru, and teach them how to use a camera to tell their own stories. I think everything you do in life makes sense when you share it.

Yo vivo en PERÚ, Aproximadamente un billete de Perú a Madrid cuesta 900 dólares. A Partir de aquí empiezo a organizarme. He recorrido ya Suecia, Finlandia y noruega en época de navidad 2015, me faltaría culminar el viaje por Dinamarca e Islandia en época de navidad 2016.

Viajo como mochilera gastanto lo mínimo indispensable en hospedaje y comida; no tengo problemas en dormir en habitaciones compartidas y comer lo más barato que encuentre, si es posible, no tengo problema en no comer tampoco. La mayor parte del dinero gastado se va en pasajes de avión. En muchos casos uso couchsurfing.

Necesito juntar 1400 dólares para culminar mi proyecto. Si no logro la meta, quisiera por lo menos poder llegar a Islandia y fotografiar auroras boreales que muy encantada podré enviarles las fotos en el formato que gustén o de la manera que gusten. En caso no junte lo mínimo para poder ir, me comprometo a realizar los talleres para niños en las zonas pobres de Perú, y enseñarles sobre la vida en los países nórdicos a donde ya he ido, guardaré el dinero hasta terminar de juntar lo que haga falta para concretar este proyecto. Tu dinero está en manos de una persona consciente y soñadora, no te preocupes que te aseguro le daré el mejor uso y te lo contaré.

 

I live in PERU, Approximately a ticket from Peru to Madrid costs $ 900. From here I begin to organize myself. I have already traveled to Sweden, Finland and Norway at Christmas time 2015 and I want to complete the Scandinavian countries tour visiting Denmark and Iceland during the Christmas season 2016.

I travel as a backpacker spend the minimum necessary in lodging and food; I have no problems sleeping in shared rooms and eating as cheaply as I can find, if possible, I have no problem in not eating either. My main expenditure is the flight ticket. In many cases I use couchsurfing.

I need to raise $ 1400 to complete my project. If I do not achieve the goal, I want at least to be able to arrive in Iceland and shoot the aurora borealis and send the photos in the format you like or the way you like. In case I do not gather the minimum to go, I promise to hold workshops for children in poor areas of Peru, and teach them about life in the Nordic countries where I have already gone, I will save the money until I finish putting together what I do To complete this project. Your money is in the hands of a conscious and dreamy person, do not worry that I assure you I will use in the best way. 

Este proyecto pretende mostrar las diferentes formas y estilos de vida de los países nórdicos, costumbres, comida, fenómenos naturales como las auroras boreales. La vida en Dinamarca, Suecia, Noruega, Finlandia e Islandia es tan alejada para nosotros, las personas que vivimos en Latinoamérica. Este proyecto es único pues para muchos peruanos como yo, es realmente un sueño poder visitar y llevar conmigo la cámara un privilegio para poderlo mostrar al mundo.

Es la primera vez que uso este medio para poder ayudarme y culminar este proyecto. He viajado por 34 países en el mundo. Pasando por 4 continentes Algunos países como China, Rusia, Marruecos, etc. Les voy a dejar algunas imágenes para que puedan revisar mi trabajo.

Desde los 12 años he viajado pues jugaba ajedrez, siempre pensé que la mejor forma de aprender sobre la vida y el mundo era conociéndolo. No sé cuando se volvió el viaje parte necesaria de mi vida, me siento muy feliz de compartir este sueño con mucha gente que me anima a seguir en este camino. Gracias por tomarte el tiempo de leer estos textos.

 

This project aims to show the different forms and lifestyles of the Nordic countries, customs, food, natural phenomena such as the aurora borealis. Life in Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland and Iceland is so different for Latinamericans . This project is unique because for many Peruvians like me, it is really a dream to visit and take with me the camera a privilege to be able to show it to the world.

 This is the first time I use this kind of help to complete this project. I have traveled around 34 countries in the world. Going around 4 continents and visiting exothic cpuntries like China, Russia, Morocco, etc. I will leave some images so that they can review my work.

 Since I was 12 years old I traveled because I was playing chess, I always thought that the best way to learn about life and the world was to know it. I do not know when the trip became necessary part of my life, I feel very happy to share this dream with many people who encourage me to continue on this path. Thank you for taking the time to read these texts.

Pienso que mi principal problema es el costo de los billetes aéreos, lo demás lo tengo bastante resuelto. En caso del hospedaje siempre habrá una buena persona que me ayude y en el caso de la alimentación me basta con comer una vez al día jaja. Realmente lo único que espero es poder llegar a estos lugares que me faltan.

I think my main problem is the cost of air tickets, the rest I have quite resolved. In case of lodging there will always be a good person to help me and in the case of food I only eat once a day haha. Really the only thing I hope is to get to the place that are missing to finish my project..

I have already traveled to Sweden, Finland and Norway at Christmas time 2015 and I want to complete the Scandinavian countries tour visiting Denmark and Iceland during the Christmas season 2016.I travel as a backpacker spend the minimum necessary in lodging and food; I have no problems sleeping in shared rooms and eating as cheaply as I can find, if possible, I have no problem in not eating either. My main expenditure is the flight ticket. In many cases I use couchsurfing.I need to raise $ 1400 to complete my project. If I do not achieve the goal, I want at least to be able to arrive in Iceland and shoot the aurora borealis and send the photos in the format you like or the way you like. In case I do not gather the minimum to go, I promise to hold workshops for children in poor areas of Peru, and teach them about life in the Nordic countries where I have already gone, I will save the money until I finish putting together what I do To complete this project. Your money is in the hands of a conscious and dreamy person, do not worry that I assure you I will use in the best way. Este proyecto pretende mostrar las diferentes formas y estilos de vida de los países nórdicos, costumbres, comida, fenómenos naturales como las auroras boreales. La vida en Dinamarca, Suecia, Noruega, Finlandia e Islandia es tan alejada para nosotros, las personas que vivimos en Latinoamérica. Este proyecto es único pues para muchos peruanos como yo, es realmente un sueño poder visitar y llevar conmigo la cámara un privilegio para poderlo mostrar al mundo.Es la primera vez que uso este medio para poder ayudarme y culminar este proyecto. He viajado por 34 países en el mundo. Pasando por 4 continentes Algunos países como China, Rusia, Marruecos, etc. Les voy a dejar algunas imágenes para que puedan revisar mi trabajo.Desde los 12 años he viajado pues jugaba ajedrez, siempre pensé que la mejor forma de aprender sobre la vida y el mundo era conociéndolo. No sé cuando se volvió el viaje parte necesaria de mi vida, me siento muy feliz de compartir este sueño con mucha gente que me anima a seguir en este camino. Gracias por tomarte el tiempo de leer estos textos. This project aims to show the different forms and lifestyles of the Nordic countries, customs, food, natural phenomena such as the aurora borealis. Life in Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland and Iceland is so different for Latinamericans . This project is unique because for many Peruvians like me, it is really a dream to visit and take with me the camera a privilege to be able to show it to the world. This is the first time I use this kind of help to complete this project. I have traveled around 34 countries in the world. Going around 4 continents and visiting exothic cpuntries like China, Russia, Morocco, etc. I will leave some images so that they can review my work. Since I was 12 years old I traveled because I was playing chess, I always thought that the best way to learn about life and the world was to know it. I do not know when the trip became necessary part of my life, I feel very happy to share this dream with many people who encourage me to continue on this path. Thank you for taking the time to read these texts.Pienso que mi principal problema es el costo de los billetes aéreos, lo demás lo tengo bastante resuelto. En caso del hospedaje siempre habrá una buena persona que me ayude y en el caso de la alimentación me basta con comer una vez al día jaja. Realmente lo único que espero es poder llegar a estos lugares que me faltan.I think my main problem is the cost of air tickets, the rest I have quite resolved. In case of lodging there will always be a good person to help me and in the case of food I only eat once a day haha. Really the only thing I hope is to get to the place that are missing to finish my project..

story:
“KeepTalkingGreece.com” started reporting and blogging from Athens Greece in spring 2010. It was initially a useful resource for expats living in Greece who had very little access to the news in English. Before long the blog had attracted followers from all over the world from every walk of life. With accurate and up-to-date reporting “KeepTalkingGreece” remains a valuable source of information for readers internationally, is a credible source of information next to mainstream media. However, more followers means more traffic, and the website crashed many times as readers and international media hungrily scrambled for direct information during the Greek crisis.

KTG had to change the server 3 times in order to cope with the unprecedented visitors’ demand.  New website design, new servers, archive transfer, server fees and website maintenance –  to mention only a few - … all costs covered by the administrator. That financial burden is now too great...

After six years of reporting and blogging, the website needs re-vamping to keep up with the continuing advances in technology and offer visitors a modern information experience. This is not a task that one solitary person can manage, outside help will need to be brought in, and this will entail even more financial outlay. 

KTG.com has a high monthly cost for technical maintenance and issues such as backups, upgrades, bug fixes, etc that allow visitors to access the site without problems. 

After six years of continuous reporting and blogging amid the economic crisis, the resources of the site administrator have been exhausted. 

My aim is to help Keep Talking Greece to raise the funds to pay outstanding server & maintenance fees for last year, cover the same expense cost for the upcoming year, to finance the essential upgrades to the website and secure that the blog will Keep Talking!

I would like to help KeepTalkingGreece to raise the funds

  • to pay the outstanding cost for the site’s server and maintenance for 2015 and secure a smooth operation for 2016.
  • to finance the essential  website revamp.
  • to reward KTG for the continuous information flow that has provided all of us in the last six years and secure its operation for 2016.

If every one of the followers were able to contribute to help Keep Talking Greece to keep on bringing us the news, explain the Greek reality in the proper context and keep blogging, then we can be sure the information will be there when we need it.

Independent journalism is a rare thing these days, especially in a crisis hit country such as Greece, and it is something which deserves our support.

Please, donate if you can, and share this fundraising page far and wide.

Many thanks

Ailsa-Burns-Maganiaris.



What is KeepTalkingGreece?

The owner and administrator is a journalist based in Athens. 

The website reports mainly about austerity policies and economy and their impact to society, about internal politics and geopolitical issues in the area as well as about EU policies that matter to all of us. From time to time, there are posts about KTG’s most favorite issue: animals and their rights because, the voiceless always need a voice to speak for them. Very rarely, a Greek recipe or two found way to KTG, but this entertaining aspect of blogging has been almost abandoned as the economic crisis deepened and political and economic developments kept KTG hostage for an awful long time.

Social media: more than 13,000 followers on Twitter, more than 8,000 Likes on Facebook.



Testimonials by KTG readers


Here is a message from KTG:

I started to report and blog from Athens in spring of 2010 after the horrible winter where international media started the Greek-bashing campaign due to the huge debt and the economic collapse of Greece. Having worked more than 25 years as a journalist and correspondent, I thought “why should we, Greeks, allow international media report about us and present Greek realities as they want to? We can do it by ourselves!” And so “Keep Talking, Greece” went live on internet.

A few hesitant steps in the beginning, a few posts as I was trying to pick up the thread… and then the tragic incidents beginning in May 2010, when 3 bank employees lost their lives during the first big anti-austerity protest. KTG reported with a live blog from Athens bringing continuous updates on the tragic events. The site collapsed due to the unprecedented number of visitors.

Every time, I hit the nail on the head with some original reporting or some reporting that was not in mainstream media and news agencies of the English-speaking world, the site collapsed - again and again. To make a long story short, altogether I had to change server more than 3 times and pay juicy amounts of money for have the archives safely transferred. If it wasn’t for Andreas, my “IT-guy” who spent hours to ”fix technical issues” and worked for KTG for an awesome little amount of money…because he loves the idea of supporting such a blog…. KTG would have ceased to function.

More than 7,000 posts have been uploaded and more than 25,000 comments have been posted by readers. Especially high is the traffic when Greece is about to economically collapse, exit the Eurozone, exit the Schengen zone and all these zones that occasionally make Greek life so difficult. More than 3 million people –it can be also 5m- have visited KTG, with lots of them been registered as “returning visitors”.

In these five and a half years of reporting, I experienced a lot of support from people I've never met. People who have been following the blog right from the beginning. People I have never met and yet we have a feeling of community or knowing each other. This is the power of the internet and social media. Real names do not matter. 5.5 years ago, I had a bet with a friend that one can gain “credibility” even if his name is XY. It is the brand that matters; it is the sense of duty towards journalism, reporting without distorting, and the duty towards the readers. This is all what matters, and that’s “Keep Talking, Greece.”

Dozens of main stream media and blogs have used KTG’s reports all these years, among them The Guardian, the Washington Post and recently the New York Times. Dozens of newspapers in Scandinavia and UK, and Italy, France, Spain, USA, The Netherlands have quoted and linked to KTG.com. Certainly for a good reason.

KTG was the first to report for the English-speaking audience about this unfortunate blond angel, Maria, the little Roma girl that was apparently stolen. Famous chef Gordon Ramsey sought the aid of our blog in order to track down British chefs in Greece. There are hundreds of success stories all these years… I don’t keep records. No time. I prefer reporting and blogging. And make plans to offer more interactive tools to KTG readers, if it wasn’t for the need of extra staff, of extra money.

All these years I experienced a lot of joy due to people’s support and positive feedback. Of course, during the hard “Greek times and the Greek-bashing” I received also a lot of poison and insults. But the people’s, my readers’ support was stronger and kept me going. And I am grateful. But I cannot keep up the reporting and blogging anymore if there is no material support by the readers and supporters.


Who is KeepTalkingGreece?

The owner and administrator is a journalist based in Athens.

In the six years of reporting and blogging, several people offered short-term voluntary work. They came and went. Because all available resources would be spent only for technical issues. Occasionally, KTG-readers offered to post comments and analysis about the Greek crisis and the society. They came and are here to stay, together with “KeepTalking,Greece”.


Perks of this Campaign

Is it true that you can’t live without a handwritten postcard sent from Athens? Or that you definitely need a T-Shirt with a KeepTalkingGreece logo? Or a mug? Unfortunately at this point and given the financial and personal situation, no perks can be given out as an award for the contributors of this campaign.

We think that the main and most important perk you receive is to ensure that “www. keeptalkingreece.com” continues reporting and blogging for 2016 thus providing a global audience with insight news from Greece in times of economic crisis and austerity madness.

All contributors will be added on a special page of the website together with a “Thank You” shout out. Every contribution helps no matter how small or big. If you are not able to fund the campaign, please, share it in your social media, websites and blogs.

story: Imagine flying your Drone over a makeshift city of five foot buildings in  a indoor arena. While you are flying your digitized Drone you are able to lock onto digital coupons of your famous restaurants and other brick and mortar places from your local neighborhood as well as your national advertisers like Ford, Chevy, Red Lobster or Olive Garden just to name a few. Your Drone has just become your "mouse"--- the arena you are flying in becomes the "internet"  While you are flying you acquire flight miles that you can use as discounts at participating advertisers locations. Families and friends coming together, near and far and sharing the experience together. Each flyer will be notified by the staff when its their turn to fly and all of their coupons and winnings will be recorded at the end of their flight. Currently there is over 10,000 Drones being purchased per month! It has been the top Christmas gift for the past 2 years! Funds will be used to develop a prototype, video production costs and travel to potential investors that can digitize to setup  this multi million dollar new way of the exchange of goods and services and at the same time family and friends having fun and increasing family time. Our system would need to be portable and be able to set up at any indoor arena baseball, football or basketball during their off season.of what contributors will help you achieve.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Annie, I started fashion study in high school in Vancouver and graduated college in Fashion Design and Technology Program in Canada. After obtaining an MBA in the UK, I launched the brand “ALPS Annie Ling”. I have passion in the apparel industry and wanted to offer affordable high quality new clothing experiences to people.

We are now developing this collection using nano silver ion technology with COOLMAX® yarn patented by INVISTA™ USA which have been tested and proven by the lab that the material can permanently eliminate 99% germs and bacteria.

When I learnt about this technology, I immediately wanted to develop a timeless high quality clothing line that could provide high protection against germs in everyday wear. This is  especially good for kid, elderly people or people who travels a lot. Traveling is fun but public places around the world may not have the cleanest environments. Travel exposes people to settings where there is a high rate of germ transfer, such as buses, trains, parks and theatre etc.

https://abcnews.go.com/Business/ConsumerNews/gma-germ-test-shows-public-seats-full-bacteria/story?id=13697290

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kkv6zLo32BY

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to support and keep this project alive, so that more people can enjoy and benefit the high protection from nowadays technology. We have made a lot of effort in sourcing, design and development; however, we are still a small emerging brand, we need enough support to commit the huge order minimum of material for production in order to keep the project continue. 

Due to the high technology involved in making this permanent 99% germ killing material, the fabric lead-time is long (minimum 3 months) and the order minimum is high (5000y = around 5000 pcs of kid overcoat). After received the material, it is another 45 days of product production. We want to launch it faster and we made the fabric order already, but we need your support to keep this project going.

 

We have ordered the material 4 months ago, and have made the 5th proto on the products in the past 15 months. We have the material in hand and committed to deliver the products because we see the needs in the market and want to develop a fashion technology platform to provide more choices to people for better protect ourselves in style.  

Imagine the future we could be well protected by this technology and have less chance to get germs transmission, we could live more healthily. 

Give yourself and your loved ones better protection with today's technology.

 

 

Silver is a highly effective, natural agent and has been proven safe to humans, animals, and plants. Tests have shown that on unprotected surfaces, bacteria can double in number every 20 minutes. Mitigating the effects of this rapid escalation, Silver ion technology inhibits bacterial growth by 99.94%. Silver ion technology resists and inhibits the growth of microorganisms by forming a protective surface against microbes, pathogens, and bacteria, such as E. coli and Staph. It also suppresses the growth of harmful mold, mildew, and fungus. Without bacteria, therefore without odor. 

Risks & Challenges

Face Mask can help prevent transmission of germs and the silver ion material can eliminate 99% of germs in 24 hours; however, this is not something that can prevent people from getting sick. There still isn't a mask that can form a perfect seal with no gaps to prevent airborne viruses in; germs could still coming through the mask when the mask is not properly worn. Also suggests that the use of masks should always be paired with regular hand washing.

https://www.healthline.com/health/cold-flu/mask#1

The project is now launching at manufacturing production peak season, if our order is small, factory may put us on a lower priority on the production schedule. We want your help to make this happen with good enough supports for factory to run the production line smoothly. 

We are working closely with reliable manufacturers who are also working with high luxury brands. We are confident with their workmanship. They are professional and attention to details. We believe if we have enough support in this project, they could help the delivery time as per planned.  

Even if we may not get huge amount of support at the end, we are already on the final stage of proto making and we are ready to go.

On the other hand, though, if this project is going to be extremely successful, there will be backers need to wait for a little longer to get their rewards. If orders are over the few thousand yards we have, we will need to order more fabric for (minimum 3 months' time) and then we will need another 45 days to make the production. We are committed to make and ship all our orders.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this project is not something interested to you, maybe your friends will like it. Please send to people you think may benefit from this technology development; especially for the people who has kids, for elderly people or for people who travels a lot. They are the ones who may need extra protection.

story:
Founder Ken Analla is a baseball enthusiast.  Throughout the years at his sons’ little league games he heard “What’s the score” more times than he could count and that was just in one game.  Anyone who has been to a community baseball or softball game has experienced this since most of these fields do not have scoreboards.   Ken started thinking about a portable scoreboard.  One that can be easily used, rolled up, hung, and taken anywhere the game is played.  Now everyone can know the score, what inning, the outs, balls and strikes at any time during the game.  It will enhance the game experience in a simple non-distracting way. 

Using his 25+ years of experience in the manufacturing industry including management, design, production, electronics, and engineering, he created the Hits A Run Scoreboard.  For the past 4 years, Ken has been developing, designing, and building this product to bring added enjoyment to the game he loves.

 

Scoreboard Features

Durable

Removable, Rechargeable, Replaceable Power Bank

Battery Life - (5) 2 hour day games or (10) 2 hour night games

Weather Resistant

Easy portability

Hand held remote

Day/Night Feature

Hanging Feature

Made in the USA

 

Where will investment go?

Materials

Tooling

Facilities

 

What’s in it for you?

Campaign contribution of $100 + shipping will secure you one of the first 500 units to be delivered in April 2019.  This is a 55% discount off the full retail value.

 

Ways you can help

Other ways you can help the campaign, is by simply spreading the word about our product and helping us reach as many people as possible.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools. located by the Back It Button, to help us reach our goal.

story:
Only need one hand to open or close the tools of FLASH S803 multitool, which solves the limitation of using tools with both hands in an emergency.

        The wire cutters are used a lot in daily work, and the degree of wear is quite large under high-intensity use. Once damaged, it is difficult to continue to use.

        The design of replacealbe cutters has solved this problem to a great extent. The broken piece can be replaced at any time without replacing the whole pliers, which greatly prolongs the service life of the tool.

  

        The flint rod and whistle are combined together, and the two are split or assembled by twisting. To a certain extent, the space and weight of the entire tool are saved.

       The knife of FLASH S803 adopts a drop-point blade, suitable for peeling and cutting. In a complex outdoor environment, this small knife can help you solve many things, like cutting branches, food and rope.

       The reammer is combined with an awl for outdoor needlework. If a tent or other fabric is damaged, pick it up and sew it in time. It will take care of your immediate needs when you need it.

The belt clip is designed for portability.Don’t have to worry about being easily lost.

       The handle of traditional multitool is generally made of thin sheet for shaft support, which is relatively weak in bearing. The leverage point of the pliers head of FLASH S803 and the elastic wall are made of a sheet metal integrated molding process, which greatly strengthens the force of the handle, prolong the service life of product.

       Each component of FLASH S803 is made by precision blanking, which ensures that the section of blanking is burr free, and the edge is smooth and delicate. On the other hand, compared with ordinary stamping, steel structure will be more stable and stronger.

       We adopt smooth arc design for the whole appearance, and each corner is very smooth, so that you can feel comfortable to play or work. Won’t hurt your hands even for high - intensity work.

      The sandblasted coating is a good barrier to the oxidation reaction between the product and the air. It is corrosion-resistant and rust-proof and suitable for use in outdoor humid environments.
