story:
THE UBER OF TRAVEL IS FINALLY HERE!

Our concept has been named ¨¨ The ultimate game changer for the Travel world ¨

Uber and Lyft changed the taxi concept, and they did it by making the consumer part of their service delivery process. At SUYO, (YOURS IN SPANISH) we knew that Travel was the next industry waiting only for the right technology to become part of this list of collaborative economy concepts, so we decided to make it happen and now we are going viral and global, making Travel more affordable for everyone!

We are starting our Global Pre-Launch and in this phase we aim to invite users to become part of our core group of Global Brand Ambassadors for different markets to benefit from the launch of our concept to the entire world! We have already 3000 happy members around the world that organically  find us even before we open doors, now with the launch of our marketing technology that allows anyone with a social media account to become part of the shift of an industry, we are ready to create a new generation of travellers & collaborative economy entrepreneurs!

The viral effect is already showing, we have motivated distributors from all over the world inquiring about how they can position themselves in our system before it goes global.  If you are here maybe is because one of our early Founding Members thinks you should be part of this movement or you are looking at position yourself as an early adopter of the next change.

Whatever the case may be we are glad you are here now and we invite you to join the movement ,the objective of this campaign is to raise funds to be used after January 2016 in pampering our founding members to get testimonials as far as the usage of the system, also founding members will choose a cause to donate 10% of the amount in January 23, 2016 when we will launch the social initiative of the company in our kick off event in Miami Florida where we will present our celebrity brand ambassadors! 

And since we are looking for talented ambassador and influencers the top ten people that refer more people to this campaign will get an equal share of a twenty percent of the funds collected! Just refer the campaign and once your invite joins let us know through the message board! You will get your share of the twenty percent plus the choice of getting a distribution agreement for 2016!

As a CrowdFunding members you will get our product at a discounted price and your name in our founding member list of honour in our website for life! Also we are pledging the commitment of pampering you with the best benefits perks and rewards the company has plan in the following year!  More importantly we invite you to be part of something great with a very cool group of people that love travel!

We welcome everyone but if you are Latino or love the Latin culture this is an special opportunity to join a Latino company ready to go global!

Join the movement, we want you to become part of the next great success story!

Welcome to SUYO!

story:
What this really is, in a nutshell

We are organizing extraordinary travel experiences with incredible parties!

We replace standard corporate travelling packages to real fun with extraordinary experiences. We assemble a series of events for you that we already tried and loved. On top of all that, we give you the opportunity to put together a customized weekend packed with events of your liking, which we exclusively organize just for You!

We shape Your dreams into experience!

Organize an event like ordering a pizza:

As the pasta, Budapest with accomodation is given.

You can choose from many toppings like:

  •        Bubble Soccer
  •        Winetasting
  •         Spa-party
  •         Beerbike
  •         Trial driving
  •         Partybus
  •         Riverboat Cruise
  •         Kitten- becausewhynot
  •         Pubcrawl
  •         Real-life room escape game
  •         Costume party 
  •         extreme out-door events; skydiving, wakeboard, quad biking, go-kart race, 

We have plenty more ideas where those came from...

On the top of our partypizza the spice is the lovely team of HUNGover.

Keep reading! :)


Extended explanation

Our concept is to provide a whole new kind of experience for the young, adult and elderly who are hungry for some adventure and travelling, spiced with cool programs.

We have travelled all around the world, mainly in Europe. In our experience, trips organized by travel agencies are very good, we've seen a lot of interesting things, but there's still something missing. Then we realized that this particular 'something' is life itself. We always missed to have the opportunity to be lost in the charm of the city, in its daylife and nightlife, to get to know the locals, instead we only got to attend the usual touristy sightseeing programs.

We attempted to fill this void by organizing a lot of programs involving a whole lot of people from all around the world, day or night, in many cities around Europe. I think we succeeded in filling this void, many evenful weekend are behind us now, we all have fond memories about them.

This is what we want to bring to you now. We are starting a company through which we can all invest our experience about organizing exciting and unforgettable experiences around Europe, so you can have as much fun as we did :) In the first round we start from Budapest, a city which is equally famous for its history as well as its nightlife, then we will expand to the surrounding cities as well. So what is this exactly? Check this out:

What if we took you and your friends to a sightseeing tour on a beerbike where you can drink your beer while looking at the beautiful sights until the keg runs out, then we would show you the world famous ruin bars of Budapest (only the best ones of course), then we would have a party at the most international clubs of the city. Naturally, we would not forget about our wine culture of Hungary, which will be introduced to you on a guided wine tasting, then comes a spa party in one of our most famous spas! Then we'll see what awaits in the night :)

But if you don't particularly like these options and you were thinking of something different, we will come up with all kinds of event packages, of which you can freely choose.

Aaand, so you can really get everything, we are working on an option where you can choose the time when you'd like to come, what kind of events you'd like to go to and we will organize everything for you so everything can go smoothly.

We make your dream weekend come true!


Questions that will help you decide if you really are interested in us :) If at least 3 is true about you, then you surely are!

You don't want to be the one who organises every single detail and be responsible for everything while travelling?

Are there any kind of program that you usually don't think of, but you would love to try it?

You come home from your holidays and all you can show your friends are buildings and paintings?

Would you like to get to know the nightlife as well as the museums?

Would you like to try more than one place to party in one night?

Do you still have some extreme boxes to tick on your bucket list?

Do you like the words 'party' and 'freedom' better than 'previous engagement'?

Do you just simply want to have an unforgettable experience?

Do you want all that in a secure environment with cheered up guides? :)

Would you like to choose from a lot of opportunities and assemble your ideal weekend for yourself?

Have you ever thought of how nice would a weekend abroad be, only you couldn't be bothered to look after every single detail?

Do you like to go to party to new places and try new things?

If you found any of those questions interesting, keep reading!


Ways you can help

You can support us with money, but not only that way. Support us!

  1. Support our project with a smaller amount, or ask us for a Perk
  2. Like our Facebook page, and share it with friends who might also be interested. Spread the word to the world! :) https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hungover/6687540...
  3. Follow us on Twitter! https://twitter.com/HungoverBp
  4. We will launch a blog as well, we'll share that with you once we are running the campaign.
  5. Subscribe to our newsletter here: http://eepurl.com/8RG0f
  6. Tell us your opinion about our project. Is this a good idea or not? What is it that you like, what is it that you don't like? Do you have any wishes for a program, or any other ideas? Write us an e-mail to this address: pr@hungover.eu


Where does the money go

We use the donations entirely to run the company, to improve its infrastructure and to make advertisements.

Costs of running the company for the 1st year: 2400 EUR

Costs for the office and other infrastructural costs: 4000 EUR

Website maintenance and development, including the special user interface for assembling the weekends: 4000 EUR

Marketing and ads: 2400 EUR

Organizing, reserving and renting costs for the programs provided by us: 4700 EUR

Tax payments towards different authorities (PayPal, tax office in Hungary): 2500 EUR


Frequently asked questions


  • What does the delivery date mean under the program packages?

We can start to organize your weekend after the given month, so you can pick any date (in 2015) after the given month at your convenience for the arrival.

  • Why should you choose us?

We provide and make experiences come true. We have several years of event and party organising experience. We also have been to the programs we provide, we are familiar with the locations and the opportunities, and we are constantly working for you to get the very best so the trip abroad can really remain unforgettable, so you can tell even your grandkids about it :)

  • Do you take care of the travelling as well and if so, is it included in the price?

No, you have to take care of your way here and back, we pick you up at the place of your arrival and then the fun can start :) Also at the end we will take you to your destination for your way back. Because of this, you have to pay for your travelling costs separately of course.

  • Can we come at any time, any day?

Yes of course, just let us know about your arrival time and leave the rest to us!

  • Do the packages include accommodation?

You can choose that option if you want us to take care of the accommodation by category, and we will make sure you get the best place within the category :)

  • Is Budapest really a great place to party?

Yes, we can guarantee that :) If you don't take our word for it, check out these links:

Budapest is on the second place in the CNN's best citys on the world list:

http://edition.cnn.com/2013/10/16/travel/cn-traveler-top-cities/index.html

And our unique ruin bars have an own article at CNN:

http://travel.cnn.com/budapests-best-ruin-bars-051056

Good to know about us:

http://edition.cnn.com/2013/11/19/travel/things-to-know-hungary/index.html

Or just a video about Hungary:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lySnQRmQbiM


Plans for the future

After Budapest we would like to expand to other parts of the country. We would like to introduce Central Europe's biggest lake, the 'Hungarian sea' to the world, lake Balaton. We would like to show the capital of Balaton, Siófok, which is the center of freedom and relaxation, and the world famous Hungarian wines, because the surrounding hills at lake Balaton is also a big provider of top quality wines.

Hungary is also the home of many festivals. A lot of those events are being organised every year, and many of them has already won international awards. We will help our guests to get to these as well, with special offers.

In Hungary the esoteric culture is very popular, we are surrounded by a lot of energy. The heart chakra of the Earth is to be found in Hungary. According to esoterical studies this is where the Earth's energy lines meet, we can also hear the beats of the Earth's heart, this is why in English it means 'beating rock': 'Dobogó kő'. The Dalai Lama went there first when he came to Hungary, because of that it is now a place of pilgrimage. We would like to show this side of Hungary to the people who are open to it, so they can get closer to their inner peace.


Get to know us!

A dynamic new team in tourism

Ildi: The younger of the Antal-siblings, Ildi is the center of the group, the soul of Hungover, the boss. She was born to organize, many events, international conferences were directed by her. A curly haired full-of-life person. For her, building up Hungover is such a fun project as you will see if you choose one of our programs. The girl who always makes crazy ideas come true and who is always in the mood for a party.

Jani: John 'the first' Antal, the elder brother from the Antal-siblings. The man on the team who always remains calm, even when the five girls are dancing on his nerves. A friend with a special supportive attitude that makes our job more fun than it is already. The brains who provides the framework for all the crazy ideas that'll let them prosper. Beneath his practical and party layer you can find a real philosopher.

Luca: Inventor of extreme ideas. If she guides you through the weekend, it'll surely be an unforgettable one. A one-woman creative team, you can always turn to her for the proper crazy ideas. If you experience something you haven't experienced before, you can be sure it popped out of her head.

Csenge: She is our youngest explorer, full ov vitality, openness and a constant smile on her face. Our nicest guide, you can only hope you'll get to meet her. She likes to play the guitar and the ukulele, if she's not preparing conceptual designs as a university student. She also has the affinity to spend some time in design ruin pubs with friends and others. She loves any kind of travelling, her most preferred vehicle is 'hitchiking' :). She is the gem within all our guides who'll always take you to the best parties.

Anett: the open minded lady, has a special love for capoeira and freedom. She always has a positive attitude and a smile on her face. You'll surely find the common ground with her and you'll have the best time with her.

Petra: She is our German language expert and one of the coolest members, lady of the ruin bars. She always has both her feet on the ground, but she also sweeps everyone off their feet with her charming personality. If you need anything at all, feel free to tell her, you can make sure she'll take care of it!

Alex: the fresh meat of the group who keeps us thinking out of the box. He's a traveler with many great and crazy adventures behind him. He also loves to explore Budapest with fellow travelers in order to gain new experiences even in his homeland. If  you want to hear exciting hitchhiking stories while fighting through the wild jungle of Budapest, then he is your guide.


Our story

We got to know each other at university, where we all were members in an international student organisation. We started working voluntarily with people from other countries then and we instantly fell in love with it. We organised lots of kind of events for our foreign friends from whole conferences to simple pubcrawls. The most enjoyable part was that we got to show them how wonderful, exciting and open Hungary is.

„These experiences left us with fond memories. One of my favourites was a fancy dress party organized for a group of 10 Croatians and 10 Turkish friends.”

Every student went home with unforgettable memories. We want to show this to the whole world! Our goal is to show every group that comes to Hungary the real experience of a weekend in Budapest, so they can go home with the best memories of their lives.


Budapest

Budapest is situated in the middle of Europe and has 2 million inhabitants, and it always gets the most prestigious places on touristic international ratings. Budapest is a constantly developing, cosmopolitan city full of opportunities. Its architectural and cultural values are being more and more recognized around the world, we on the other hand want to show this city from a different angle. Get to know Budapest's young, vibrant side! Spend a weekend with us, we guarantee it to be full of new experiences and adrenalin!

„Budapest is our home, and we did everything to know about its wildest sides...”

Budapest's modern vibe and openness makes it possible to properly relax and release the tension for anyone who comes here. Lively open-air clubs await, unique ruin bars, escape games, beerbikes on the most beautiful streets of the city and paintball games in the old army bases. You didn't try some of them yet? That is only a couple of all the options our adventure seeking customers can choose from!



Perks

Important! Please read the details of perks here to be clear about everything! If you choose a package and travel with us, than you accept our Terms of use

€10 Big thank you and love

Big thank you and love

With your contribution you become part of a dream coming true and a magical travelling experience! The whole Hungover team is eternally grateful for you help to take us one step closer to realise a product that can help others dreams come true!

€35 Be part of Hungover's history

Our grace will be with you forever because thanks to you we can achieve our goal. We will display your name on our website on the main page, so you can have a trace in Hungover's history (unless you don't want us to display your name), and also your name can be a link to a website of your own choice (within boundaries of course).

€50 Unique team photo just for you

Pick a monument or any famous place in Budapest, and we'll make a photo of it as a thank you which will be unique and especially for you!

In addition to that we'll display your name on our website so everyone can see that the whole Hungover team is grateful for your contribution (unless you don't want us to), or your name can also be a link to another website of your choice (within boundaries of course).


€100 Gift for you

A €100 discount is yours from any one of our packages, or from your customized weekend. It can be redeemed by anyone, it is the perfect gift! Our packages are being organized above a minimum of 4 participants.

In addition to that we'll display your name on our website so everyone can see that the whole Hungover team is grateful for your contribution (unless you don't want us to), or your name can also be a link to another website of your choice (within boundaries of course).


€300 Big gift for you 

A 300€ discount is yours from any one of our packages, or from your customized weekend. It can be redeemed by anyone, it is the perfect gift! Our packages are being organized above a minimum of 4 participants. In addition to that we'll display your name on our website so everyone can see that the whole Hungover team is grateful for your contribution (unless you don't want us to), or your name can also be a link to another website of your choice (within boundaries of course).


€536 Early Bird: Easy Trip package

Fetch your friends and join us for one of our Easy Trip weekends! (One perk has a limit of 4 participants, but you can buy more and come together)

What can you expect? A cool, amusing weekend in the capital of Hungary: our guides will wait for you at the airport with a welcome drink and will take you to your accommodation, during the evenings you'll be shown the best bars and ruinpubs, and you can visit the coolest party places. The rest of your weekend is free, you can spend it with some relaxation or walking around the city.

(only transport from and to the airport is included)


In addition to that we'll display your name on our website so everyone can see that the whole Hungover team is grateful for your contribution (unless you don't want us to), or your name can also be a link to another website of your choice (within boundaries of course).


€940 Hungarian Speciality package

Would you like to know how the proper Hungarian fun goes? Tell your friends and try our Hungarian Speciality weekend! (One perk has a limit of 4 participants, but you can buy more and come together)

What can you expect? You can get to know unique Hungarian programs, like the world famous Hungarian ruinbars and the thrilling escape rooms. Above that, a proper Hungarian wine tasting awaits with the finest wines of the country, also you can ride the famous Beerbike. Our guides will wait for you at the airport with a welcome gift and they will guide you through all the programs.

(only transport from and to the airport is included)


€1,220 Be a real Sir!

Party like a sir! Be a gentleman and join us with your friends for a Party Like a Sir weekend! (One perk has a limit of 4 participants, but you can buy more and come together)

On this weekend you really can feel like a king! A limousine will wait for you and your friends at the airport that will take you around the city while you comfortably sip your champagne. Even a king could use some excercise, so let's hop on the Beerbike and head to the Palace quarter! After this, Budapest's best clubs are waiting for you. The next day we'll start the evening with a fancy wine tasting session, where you can taste Hungary's world famous wines with the help of real experts, then you go to a majestic spa for a huge Spa-party!

(local transport and airport transport are included)


€2,650 We make your dreams come true

Tell your friends and assemble a superb weekend, choose from our programs, let us know when you'll be arriving and then leave the rest of the organising to us! (One perk has a limit of 5 participants, but you can buy more and come together)

You can take a look at our programs here: http://indiegogo.hungover.eu/

Of which you can choose 6 day programs and 4 night programs (you can choose less). Only transport from and to the airport is included.


€3700 Have fun with the best team

Assemble the best weekend of your life and party with the Hungover team!

Assemble a weekend by choosing from our programs, or choose one of our packages, tell your friends (the limit is 8 participants: you and your friends), we will organise everything for you and the whole Hungover team will spend the weekend with you!

You can take a look at our programs here: http://indiegogo.hungover.eu/

Of which you can choose 6 day programs and 4 night programs (you can choose less). Only transport from and to the airport is included.


€5000 Be your name our name

Assemble the best weekend of your life and party with the Hungover team!

Assemble a weekend by choosing from our programs, or choose one of our packages, tell your friends (the limit is 8 participants: you and your friends), we will organise everything for you and the whole Hungover team will spend the weekend with you!

In addition to all that, the package you assemble for you and your friends will be named after you (or anyone of your choosing) and it will be displayed on our website as a special offer throughout 2015.

You can take a look at our programs here: http://indiegogo.hungover.eu/

Of which you can choose 6 day programs and 4 night programs (you can choose less). Only transport from and to the airport is included.
story_txt:
What this really is, in a
nutshellWe are organizing extraordinary travel experiences with incredible parties!
We replace standard corporate travelling packages to real
fun with extraordinary experiences. We assemble a series of events for you that
we already tried and loved. On top of all that, we give you the opportunity to put
together a customized weekend packed with events of your liking, which we
exclusively organize just for You!
We shape Your dreams into experience!Organize an event like ordering a pizza:As the pasta, Budapest with accomodation is given.You can choose from many toppings like:

       Bubble Soccer

       Winetasting
        Spa-party
        Beerbike
        Trial driving
        Partybus
        Riverboat Cruise
        Kitten- becausewhynot
        Pubcrawl
        Real-life room escape game
        Costume party 
        extreme out-door events; skydiving, wakeboard, quad biking, go-kart race, 
We have plenty more ideas where those came from...On the top of our partypizza the spice is the lovely team of HUNGover.
Keep reading! :)
Extended explanation
Our concept is to provide a whole new kind of experience for
the young, adult and elderly who are hungry for some adventure and travelling,
spiced with cool programs.
We have travelled all around the world, mainly in Europe. In
our experience, trips organized by travel agencies are very good, we've seen a
lot of interesting things, but there's still something missing. Then we
realized that this particular 'something' is life itself. We always missed to
have the opportunity to be lost in the charm of the city, in its daylife and
nightlife, to get to know the locals, instead we only got to attend the usual
touristy sightseeing programs.
We attempted to fill this void by organizing a lot of
programs involving a whole lot of people from all around the world, day or
night, in many cities around Europe. I think we succeeded in filling this void,
many evenful weekend are behind us now, we all have fond memories about them.
This is what we want to bring to you now. We are starting a
company through which we can all invest our experience about organizing
exciting and unforgettable experiences around Europe, so you can have as much
fun as we did :) In the first round we start from Budapest, a city which is
equally famous for its history as well as its nightlife, then we will expand to
the surrounding cities as well. So what is this exactly? Check this out:
What if we took you and your friends to a sightseeing tour
on a beerbike where you can drink your beer while looking at the beautiful
sights until the keg runs out, then we would show you the world famous ruin
bars of Budapest (only the best ones of course), then we would have a party at
the most international clubs of the city. Naturally, we would not forget about
our wine culture of Hungary, which will be introduced to you on a guided wine
tasting, then comes a spa party in one of our most famous spas! Then we'll see
what awaits in the night :)
But if you don't particularly like these options and you
were thinking of something different, we will come up with all kinds of event
packages, of which you can freely choose.
Aaand, so you can really get everything, we are working on
an option where you can choose the time when you'd like to come, what kind of
events you'd like to go to and we will organize everything for you so
everything can go smoothly.
We make your dream
weekend come true!
Questions that will help
you decide if you really are interested in us :) If at least 3 is true about
you, then you surely are!
You don't want to be the one who organises every single
detail and be responsible for everything while travelling?
Are there any kind of program that you usually don't think
of, but you would love to try it?
You come home from your holidays and all you can show your
friends are buildings and paintings?
Would you like to get to know the nightlife as well as the
museums?
Would you like to try more than one place to party in one
night?
Do you still have some extreme boxes to tick on your bucket
list?
Do you like the words 'party' and 'freedom' better than
'previous engagement'?
Do you just simply want to have an unforgettable experience?
Do you want all that in a secure environment with cheered up
guides? :)
Would you like to choose from a lot of opportunities and
assemble your ideal weekend for yourself?
Have you ever thought of how nice would a weekend abroad be,
only you couldn't be bothered to look after every single detail?
Do you like to go to party to new places and try new things?
If you found any of those questions interesting, keep
reading!
Ways you can help
You can support us with money, but not only that way.
Support us!

Support
     our project with a smaller amount, or ask us for a Perk
Like
     our Facebook page, and share it with friends who might also be interested.
     Spread the word to the world! :) https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hungover/6687540...

Follow
     us on Twitter! https://twitter.com/HungoverBp

We
     will launch a blog as well, we'll share that with you once we are running
     the campaign.
Subscribe
     to our newsletter here: http://eepurl.com/8RG0f

Tell
     us your opinion about our project. Is this a good idea or not? What is it
     that you like, what is it that you don't like? Do you have any wishes for
     a program, or any other ideas? Write us an e-mail to this address: pr@hungover.eu


Where does the money go
We use the donations entirely to run the company, to improve
its infrastructure and to make advertisements.
Costs of running the company for the 1st year: 2400 EUR
Costs for the office and other infrastructural costs: 4000 EUR
Website maintenance and development, including the special
user interface for assembling the weekends: 4000 EUR
Marketing and ads: 2400 EUR
Organizing, reserving and renting costs for the programs
provided by us: 4700 EUR
Tax payments towards different authorities (PayPal, tax
office in Hungary): 2500 EUR

program packages?
We can start to organize your weekend after the
given month, so you can pick any date (in 2015) after the given month at your convenience
for the arrival.

story:
Inkstinct Tattoo App is the app set to connect tattoo lovers with all the artists around the world by sharing inspirational drawings and spreading the culture of this art.

Who we are

Fueled by an incredible passion we started this project on 2011. We are a talented group of italians guys, from 23 to 32 years old. We work as bartenders, community managers and web designers.

What we do

So far Inkstinct Tattoo is one of the biggest App tattoo related in the store. It's powered by a complex algorithm that automatically, every minute, scans the Facebook pages of over 600.000 tattoo artists and studios located all around the world searching for their art-works. The app then organises no-stop these automatic-update researches in different categories, locations, inspirational sections and a blog. The users can access to the art-works and informations of all the tattoo studios and artists or simply get inspired by the app.

Inkstinct Tattoo App has:

  • 58k followers on Instagram
  • 7k followers on Facebook
  • 120k downloads between Apple App Store and Google Play Store
  • Feature on Apple App Store as Best App on November 2014
  • Nominated as "Innovator App" by Repubblica.it (Top3 Italian Magazine)


What we need (that could be what you will love soon too)

We'd like implement new functionalities in the app.

This first funding will be used to develop and implement new functionalities in order to:

  • let you directly contact your favourite studio or artist
  • expand the discover section with categories, so you can browse on the first page artists, studios AND categories you like
  • let you upload your own tattoo pictures
  • let other users find you and follow you
  • comments under every picture in the app

Why we need you

The crowdfunding will lead us to develop and implement all the new functionalities and it will bring Inkstinct Tattoo App to the next level.

Inkstinct Tattoo App would also like to improve the desktop platform. The app counts already thousands of studios and artists profiles, however we wish to offer the best user experience and the possibility for the artists to have a better promotion.

Last but not least, part of the investments will be allocated in marketing strategies in order to diffuse the uniqueness of the app.


Please, 

Download the app at inkstinctapp.com/download

Follow us on Instagram  @inkstinct_tattoo_app , Facebook @inkstincttattoo, 

Twitter @inkstincttattoo and send us feedbacks. 

Indeed, that would be an helping hand, very important for our growth!

Thank you!!!

Emanuele, Matteo, Alessandro, Claudio, Luca, Giuseppe, Fabrizio

story:
Short Summary

We are 100 % funded thru individual and corporate donations. Samaritan's Hand is a faith-based drug and alcohol outpatient clinic for the Sheboygan area and lake shore communities and feel a calling to expand into other communities, we teach that Jesus is the answer to all sin....not just addiction. Our counselors treat the mind, body, and spirit, acting as vessels of the Holy Spirit. We believe that with a Christ-centered, Biblical approach, our clients can find; mental, physical, emotional, along with spiritual healing. Our mission is to bring hope to the hopeless & healing for the hurting just as Christ modeled.


What We Need & What You Get

  • You will directly being helping people gain freedom from the bondage of sin and addiction and more importantly indirectcly introduce them to the truth of Christ. To get a descent building we need at least 100K.  We have a building picked out and have been operating for 4 years now, we need to reach more people and offer more services.
  • All donations are tax deductible, and for a $50 or more you will receive a gift, a  Samaraitan's Hand T-shirt.
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds that are raised will still be used as a down payment, then our regular donations and fundraising can be utilized for more programming such as; adding paid AODA counselors/staff and more groups. We currently have 2 part time employees and 1 full time counselor and a great bunch of awesome volunteers. At this time we are receiving  no grants, Samaritan's Hand is solely funded by community support. Our 5 year goal is to bring this first state, then nation wide, to communities like ours, and maybe yours, that have a growing drug epidemic.

The Impact

  • You will be helping the lost, the unwanted, the homeless,  giving hope to the hopeless. Samaritan's Hand has a high success rate, families are restored, marriages are restored, children that were taken away, placed in Foster Care, often come home to know a completely changed parent or parents. Crimes are not repeated and the cycle of bondage is finally broken. People form a relationship with Jesus and grow by His Grace.
  • All of our staff and volunteers have experience with recovery/restoration, lived lives that were transformed thru programs just like this.
  • Our community is under attack and yours may be too, we need partners and  your help....you can make a difference, change the course of someone's life.

Risks & Challenges

  • Our Director worked at the House of Corrections for Milwaukee County, Genesis and Addict outpatient centers in addition to many other secular treatment facilities, has been a counselor for 15 years, up until recently he has done this alone with no paid staff members, we now have 2 part time employees, a Program Coordinator and a Community Relations/Business Coordinator. Imagine doing this alone with a hand full of volunteers.
  • We plan to add more Counselors and staff, purchase a building (with your funding), create a job training program and long term inpatient as well as a sober living house.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share our website and Facebook Page,,,http://www.samaritanshand.org and https://www.facebook.com/samaritanshand
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
THE BAG THAT CAN ORGANIZE ANYONE 

PACKING IS EASY- Our Weekender fits seamlessly into your closet, no backache, nor large hardshell taking up space(or trip over!). Three shelves for (1) Tops+ Sweaters (2) Shoes, Accessories (3) Pants/Bottoms and two large zip pockets for (4) Toiletries  and (5) Undergarments & Socks

PADDED LAPTOP POCKET- Outside access for quickly getting through security or grabbing a magazine. Zippered pocket on top for ticket & passport, and two front pockets for cords and chargers.

FEATURES & DETAILS

From home to hotel: Your clothes stay folded and organized, just as you packed them! 

 

 

SEE IT ALL IN A GLANCE- 648 square inches of visibility of everything in your bag.

ORGANIZED- Designated pockets for toiletries, socks undies, laptop, passport/tickets, and chargers. No more tangles or confusion.

 

Waterproof PVC bottom to protect from unseen puddles.

Long Weekend? One Bag!

Even a long 4-day weekend is no problem for The Weekender. Easily stow 3 days of clothing in one TSA Approved carry-on. 

 

 

SPECS:

PERKS:

 

Design Process:

Sketches, renderings, and several iterations of samples, testing, and refinement led to our final product. We had grand dreams, then decided to prioritize on user needs: Being Organized. Jeff travels with lots of sports gear. Kristina travels with two small kids. And David likes to keep his clothes orderly. Each test run we learned what worked and didn't. Backpack straps didn't work well with weight distribution, and the first run the clothes tended to stack in the center and not be evenly distributed, resulting in disproportionate use of space. Having a place for a tablet or small laptop was vital, as was having a padded shoulder strap.

About us:

 

Greetings! We are the team behind The Weekender Bag - that organizes itself. Based out of Sonoma, California, we've been specializing in organizers for years. As travelers we anguished with disorganized, messy bags, and designed several solutions from stacking packing cubes to cord organizers. We've been designing in-house and manufacturing quality homewares from 10+ years, so we have strong relationships built with our workshop, sourcing experts, and quality control team. Kristina travelled countless visit to our workshop to understand their abilities and maximize the latest materials and construction for a fashion forward, durable bag.

story:
Welcome!


Have you ever been on vacation—driving along the coast or through a town—and wondered about the people who lived there before? Have you ever wished you could meet the storytellers, poets, historians, and musicians who live there now? 

Now you can hear the story behind the scenery with our hands-free audio tour app, designed specifically for motorists

As you drive along, a sonic tapestry of interviews, world-class performances, local humor, and beautiful narration provides a delightful cultural-historical context to landmarks ahead on the touring route. This authentic travel companion will have you wondering how you ever experienced faraway places and people before.

How it's different

Cultural Roadmapp brings together museum-quality audio tours and real-time geolocation. Unlike distracting multimedia travel apps and traditional guidebooks, our audio tour app lets you keep hands on the wheel and eyes on the view. It's the only app that offers this set of features:

As you drive, subtle audio “pings” alert you to nearby points of interest.


Ireland's Wild Atlantic Way

Our first audio tour app is a four-part series about Ireland’s west coast, one of the world's richest cultural landscapes. Presenting 12 hours of thrilling content, it's the first audio tour app ever created for the spectacular new Wild Atlantic Way driving route, which spans the 1500 miles from Cork to Donegal. 

Can't make it to Ireland? No problem! You can download the content, like a series of podcasts, and experience a virtual tour of the culture, history, and genius of this amazing island anywhere in the world.

Our campaign focus

The series pilot, which we hope to fund with your help, spotlights the magnificent County Clare. This three-hour tour is designed to be enjoyed over two days, so you can stop and explore local attractions at your leisure. And there are many.

Nestled on the Atlantic coast between Limerick and Galway cities, Clare is renowned for its thriving music and dance traditions, breathtaking geography, and captivating prehistoric, ancient, and medieval history. The county is home to the world-famous Cliffs of Moher and the stark, lunar terrain of the Burren, a limestone landscape dotted with hundreds of archaeological wonders—from megalithic tombs and portal dolmens to medieval castles, towers, forts, and abbeys. Clare is the birthplace of Ireland’s most famous high king, Brian Boru, who ruled the island over 1,000 years ago.

The county is also beloved for its annual festivities, from the hilarious to the earnest to the studious. These include the month-long “Lisdoonvarna Matchmaking Festival” and the Willie Clancy Summer School in Miltown Malbay, a.k.a. “Willie Week,” to which a pilgrimage is made each July by thousands of musicians and dancers worldwide. In 2016 and 2017, Clare’s largest town, Ennis, will host the World Championships of Irish traditional music. Known as the “All-Ireland Fleadh” [pronounced flah], the nine-day festival and music competition features top talent and attracts nearly half a million visitors across the globe.

A taste of the Clare audio tour app

Curious what this new kind of travel experience will look and sound like? Take a virtual spin on the Clare coast while listening to narration and commentary by eminent Irish music and dance scholars Dr. Mícheál Ó Súilleabháin and Dr. Catherine Foley.




The Cultural Roadmapp team

We’re a passionate transatlantic startup headquartered in New York City and Ennis, Ireland. Our principals are:



Deborah Schull

Founder & President

As a teenager, Deborah lived in Dublin and fell in love with Irish literature, landscape, music, and, of course, people. Today she’s a seasoned writer and producer whose audio tours and apps are featured at the Smithsonian Institution and the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library and Museum. Based in New York City, Deborah has won 25 professional honors, including the museum field’s prestigious MUSE Award and two Tellys. She is creative director for all Cultural Roadmapp projects.



Leah O’Brien Bernini

Director of Content Collection & Curation

Leah is an ethnomusicologist (essentially, an “anthropologist of music”) based in County Clare. She holds a PhD in Ethnomusicology from the University of Limerick, where she earned Master’s degrees in both Irish Traditional Music Performance and Ethnomusicology. She’s delivered over a dozen academic papers to acclaim throughout North America and Europe. Acknowledged as a master field researcher, Leah is also an Irish fiddle teacher and player, artist manager, and music education product designer. 



Oisín Mac Diarmada

Music Director

Hailed by the Irish Echo newspaper as “one of the most gifted and creative traditional fiddlers playing today,” Oisín is the Sligo-based founder of the renowned band Téada, with whom he has released four studio albums. A highly acclaimed solo artist as well, he released the CD The Green Branch accompanied by pianist Samantha Harvey in September 2015. Director of SCT, Ireland’s traditional music examination system, Oisín is an Irish language speaker and a champion of Irish culture worldwide.

Our Irish partners

Many of the Irish cultural world’s leading lights are on board for the Wild Atlantic Way series. We’ll update this page as more join on over the next several weeks! Here are just a few:

  • Joan Bergin, three-time Emmy Award-winning costume designer/historian for television’s The Vikings and The Tudors

  • Matt Molloy, flutist and member, The Chieftains

  • Martin Enright, vice president, Yeats Society, Sligo

  • Leo Hallisey, co-founder, Conamara Environmental Education and Cultural Centre

  • Dr. Catherine Foley, director, National Dance Archive of Ireland

  • Dr. Mark Clinton, archaeologist, An Taisce: The National Trust of Ireland

The road ahead
We’re on track to launch the County Clare audio tour app on St. Patrick’s Day 2017  and can’t wait to take our research into the field this Summer on Ireland’s Atlantic coast!  Here’s the complete schedule for creation of the Clare app:


Your support will drive us on

As you can see, in less than a year, we could all  be cruising Ireland’s Atlantic coast—to cool breezes and the sounds of local music, history, archeology, poetry, architecture, dance, ichthyology, and much more. And in under two years, we could have the entire Wild Atlantic Way covered.

But to realize this dream, we need to raise $35,000: that's the cost of creating the County Clare audio tour app from start to finish. In addition to being marketed commercially, this app will serve as our prototype for fundraising and producing the rest of the Wild Atlantic Way series. 

Be assured, any amount of support helps! Even if we make far less than our stated goal, your contribution can enable us to complete crucial early stages in production of the app. And, you're welcome to set a custom denomination by simply clicking the "BACK IT" button to the right of the campaign video. You may opt to contribute anonymously, too.

If you've read this far and have decided to become a supporter, you have our utmost gratitude! Here’s how we’ll allocate your generous contribution:



Perks & podcasts

In thanks for your support, we have many one-of-a-kind perks over on the right side of this page. Several of these perks sync with our online celebration of Irish culture, in which we released "TRIPOD,” a series of three short but fascinating podcast interviews with leading Irish cultural experts:

  • Language & Literature Week (June 13-19): podcast with Prof. Joe Nugent
  • Music & Dance Week (June 20-26): podcast with Dr. Catherine Foley
  • Film & Television Week (June 27-July 3): podcast with Joan Bergin
Check out TRIPOD!

Other ways you can help

If you love the idea of Cultural Roadmapp but can't contribute financially right now—and even if you are contributing—would you like to spread the word about us and this Indiegogo campaign? If so, please avail yourself of the social media buttons over to the right of our campaign video, and share with your networks. Thank you SO much! 


Let's take this road trip of a lifetime together!

We’ll admit it. We have grand plans—nothing short of revolutionizing the travel experience. We see a future in which our one-of-a-kind apps outfit cars, vans, and tour buses around the world, from Italy's Amalfi Coast to Germany's "Fairy Tale Route" to Ecuador's Avenue of the Volcanoes. And we want to build a vibrant community of “Roadmappers” on our website, where we can all share audio and video uploads of our cross-cultural travel adventures, trip information, rides, and much more.

But right now, that proverbial Irish road is rising to meet you. 

Will you come and greet it?


Press

Irish America Magazine heralds the launch of our campaign and new podcast series, TRIPOD  

http://irishamerica.com/2016/06/weekly-comment-new-cultural-podcast-series-in-celebration-of-bloomsday/

The Daily Update details how founder Deborah Schull's interdisciplinary college experience guided her career and led to Cultural Roadmapp

http://www.hws.edu/dailyupdate/NewsDetails.aspx?aid=19648

Connect with us

Press page: http://www.culturalroadmapp.com/press/ 

Blog: http://www.culturalroadmapp.com/#BLOG

Website: http://www.culturalroadmapp.com

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/culturalroadmapp

Twitter: http://twitter.com/culturalroadmap

Instagram: https://instagram.com/culturalroadmapp/

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/culturalroadmapp/


Contact Deborah Schull: deborah@culturalroadmapp.com


Many thanks to everyone who’s helped us so far! 

Special thanks to Irish America Magazine and Deputy Editor Adam Farley for their support.

Advisors and cultural experts: Paul Brock; Kevin Crawford; Catherine Foley; Meg Maher; J.B. Manton; Elinor Meeks; Matt Molloy; Chris O'Leary; Mícheál Ó Súilleabháin; Jon Schull; Rebecca Schull 

Present and past interns: Sara Aitken; Eleonora Berenyi; Saleah Blancaflor; Benjamin Carr; Daniel Conover; Frank Effa; Emily Ho; Amelia Jenkins; Maya Juchtman; Larisa Karr; Darren McCormack; Wynne McIntyre; Maria Miglio; Nelson Morales; Ailbhe O’Grady; Rebecca Ricks; Arber Velencia; Joel Watington; Rebecca Weber

Contractors: Josh Anderson; David Freemas; George Mokhiber; Marcelo de Oliveira; Omar Shaukat; Jamie Sweeney; Przemek Szczesny; Yi Zhang

Acknowledged as a master field researcher, Leah is also an Irish fiddle teacher and player, artist manager, and music education product designer. 


Oisín Mac Diarmada
Music Director
Hailed by the Irish Echo newspaper as “one of the most gifted and creative traditional fiddlers playing today,” Oisín is the Sligo-based founder of the renowned band Téada, with whom he has released four studio albums. A highly acclaimed solo artist as well, he released the CD The Green Branch accompanied by pianist Samantha Harvey in September 2015. Director of SCT, Ireland’s traditional music examination system, Oisín is an Irish language speaker and a champion of Irish culture worldwide.


Our Irish partners



Many of the Irish cultural world’s leading lights are on board for the Wild Atlantic Way series. We’ll update this page as more join on over the next several weeks! Here are just a few:
Joan Bergin, three-time Emmy Award-winning costume designer/historian for television’s The Vikings and The Tudors
Matt Molloy, flutist and member, The Chieftains
Martin Enright, vice president, Yeats Society, Sligo
Leo Hallisey, co-founder, Conamara Environmental Education and Cultural Centre
Dr. Catherine Foley, director, National Dance Archive of Ireland

Dr. Mark Clinton, archaeologist, An Taisce: The National Trust of Ireland



The road ahead


We’re on track to launch the County Clare audio tour app on St. Patrick’s Day 2017  and can’t wait to take our research into the field this Summer on Ireland’s Atlantic coast!  Here’s the complete schedule for creation of the Clare app:



Your support will drive us on




As you can see, in less than a year, we could all  be cruising Ireland’s Atlantic coast—to cool breezes and the sounds of local music, history, archeology, poetry, architecture, dance, ichthyology, and much more. And in under two years, we could have the entire Wild Atlantic Way covered.
But to realize this dream, we need to raise $35,000: that's the cost of creating the County Clare audio tour app from start to finish. In addition to being marketed commercially, this app will serve as our prototype for fundraising and producing the rest of the Wild Atlantic Way series. 
Be assured, any amount of support helps! Even if we make far less than our stated goal, your contribution can enable us to complete crucial early stages in production of the app. And, you're welcome to set a custom denomination by simply clicking the "BACK IT" button to the right of the campaign video. You may opt to contribute anonymously, too.
If you've read this far and have decided to become a supporter, you have our utmost gratitude! Here’s how we’ll allocate your generous contribution:





Perks & podcasts

In thanks for your support, we have many one-of-a-kind perks over on the right side of this page. Several of these perks sync with our online celebration of Irish culture, in which we released "TRIPOD,” a series of three short but fascinating podcast interviews with leading Irish cultural experts:



Language & Literature Week (June 13-19): podcast with Prof. Joe Nugent


Music & Dance Week (June 20-26): podcast with Dr. Catherine Foley



Film & Television Week (June 27-July 3): podcast with Joan Bergin



Check out TRIPOD!



Other ways you can help



If you love the idea of Cultural Roadmapp but can't contribute financially right now—and even if you are contributing—would you like to spread the word about us and this Indiegogo campaign? If so, please avail yourself of the social media buttons over to the right of our campaign video, and share with your networks. Thank you SO much! 
Let's take this road trip of a lifetime together!




We’ll admit it. We have grand plans—nothing short of revolutionizing the travel experience. We see a future in which our one-of-a-kind apps outfit cars, vans, and tour buses around the world, from Italy's Amalfi Coast to Germany's "Fairy Tale Route" to Ecuador's Avenue of the Volcanoes. And we want to build a vibrant community of “Roadmappers” on our website, where we can all share audio and video uploads of our cross-cultural travel adventures, trip information, rides, and much more.
But right now, that proverbial Irish road is rising to meet you. 

Will you come and greet it?



Press

Irish America Magazine heralds the launch of our campaign and new podcast series, TRIPOD  


http://irishamerica.com/2016/06/weekly-comment-new-cultural-podcast-series-in-celebration-of-bloomsday/
The Daily Update details how founder Deborah Schull's interdisciplinary college experience guided her career and led to Cultural Roadmapp

http://www.hws.edu/dailyupdate/NewsDetails.aspx?aid=19648


Connect with us


Press page: http://www.culturalroadmapp.com/press/ 
Blog: http://www.culturalroadmapp.com/#BLOG

Website: http://www.culturalroadmapp.com
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/culturalroadmapp
Twitter: http://twitter.com/culturalroadmap
Instagram: https://instagram.com/culturalroadmapp/
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/culturalroadmapp/

Contact Deborah Schull: deborah@culturalroadmapp.com


Many thanks to everyone who’s helped us so far! 


Special thanks to Irish America Magazine and Deputy Editor Adam Farley for their support.


Advisors and cultural experts: Paul Brock; Kevin Crawford; Catherine Foley; Meg Maher; J.B. Manton; Elinor Meeks; Matt Molloy; Chris O'Leary; Mícheál Ó Súilleabháin; Jon Schull; Rebecca Schull 



Present and past interns: Sara Aitken; Eleonora Berenyi; Saleah Blancaflor; Benjamin Carr; Daniel Conover; Frank Effa; Emily Ho; Amelia Jenkins; Maya Juchtman; Larisa Karr; Darren McCormack; Wynne McIntyre; Maria Miglio; Nelson Morales; Ailbhe O’Grady; Rebecca Ricks; Arber Velencia; Joel Watington; Rebecca Weber
Contractors: Josh Anderson; David Freemas; George Mokhiber; Marcelo de Oliveira; Omar Shaukat; Jamie Sweeney; Przemek Szczesny; Yi Zhang

story:
According to HK newspaper, Hong Kong Chief Executive, Mr Leung was accused of exerting pressure on Airport staff to bypass security and deliver a piece of luggage to his daughter who was preparing to board a plane for San Francisco. During the conversation, Leung is said to have corrected a airline staff who answered the phone to address him as “Chief Executive Leung”, rather than just “Mr. Leung”.

Our luggage tag is special for anyone who is looking for prestige or special care on your luggage like Chief Executive. The luggage tag is written in Chinese " My Dad is Leung, please take extra care on my luggage". We aim to bring out the magic power from Mr. Leung and his family to everyone by showing our smart luggage tag. 

This is 100% local design and could be use in luggage, suitcase, and handbag.

story:
Short Summary

Look around at the travel and hospitality industry, and before long, a few major flaws start to become apparent. You see that, despite the huge demand for romantic trips, there is very little specialization or attention. Honeymoons, destination weddings, and anniversaries all wind up in the same category as every other trip, which is precisely what couples don't want.

The truth is that as an industry, we can do better.

Let me introduce myself. My name is Shri. A travel tech, media pro, and entrepreneur, I have worked in travel and hospitality for more than twenty years. In addition, I have built up experience in digital marketing and weddings, leading the industry for more than a decade – at TheKnot.com, where I generated more than $50 million in media revenue.

 

 

All of that was exciting, but every step of the way, I could tell that my calling was elsewhere. After I saw my cousin book a honeymoon with a major online travel agent and experience unacceptable service, I started to think about what was possible.

That was the beginning of LOVU, the travel app that is all about romance and couples' celebratory trips. From wedding proposals to destination weddings to honeymoons to anniversaries to vow renewals to babymoons, romantic trips are easy on LOVU, where you get to develop a one-to-one relationship with hotels and travel advisors, who are going to be there for you when you need them most.

The secret underlying LOVU is this: when honeymooners show up at a hotel, the hotel naturally treats them like VIPs. This is because hoteliers understand that honeymooners are going to share and broadcast their experiences, letting their friends and family know what they can expect at the same property.

Instead, LOVU is there to take care of it all for you, to streamline the booking process so that you can let go and relax, confident that when you show up, all you have to do is experience your most authentic love.

Wherever you are in your relationship, just getting started or three decades in, LOVU empowers you to create the romantic getaway of your dreams.

 

Just think of all these problems we are going to eliminate for couples.

 

  • The time you would take to research, plan, and book romantic trips
  • The indirect relationships you would strike with hotels
  • The annoyance of finding the right person at a hotel to give you a deal
  • The time it would take you to find an experienced destination travel advisor to help you plan your perfect trip

 

LOVU – the Smarter Way to Do Romantic Trips

 

LOVU is removing the middlemen – online travel companies that provide no real value – to put you in control of your romantic travel experience. A few taps or swipes on your phone, you can make a direct reservation and link up with a travel expert anywhere in the world. We are making research, planning, and booking straightforward and even fun.

 

Check out the big business of romance – and mobile apps.

 

Compared to regular vacays, couples are shelling out three times as much money. The market for destination weddings and honeymoons in the US alone has exceeded $25 billion. Consider all these components.

Meanwhile, the market for apps is undeniably massive. It is estimated that the global number of smartphone users will rise to 3.5 billion over the course of 2020. In addition, there are more connected mobile devices globally (7.94 billion) than people, and nearly 90% of mobile internet time is spent in apps (emarketer). Most importantly, mobile users prefer apps to browsers. When we looked at the mobile industry research on time spent with 2.7 billion smartphone users, 90% of the total mobile time was spent on apps, and the average weekly time spent using travel apps was 19 minutes. (Source: BuildFire Statista 2021)

 

Enter LOVU

All of this means that the market is perfect for LOVU. There is no company dominating romance travel, which is why we are looking to raise enough seed capital to launch our app on Android and iOS devices by October 2021. We are also preselling LOVU to hotels and travel advisors via our B2B site https://lovu.travel. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our developers are busy working on LOVU programming/coding, designing, etc. To make LOVU happen by fall 2021, we are looking to raise $5,000, which help us complete our software development. Our stretch goal is $35,000, which will help us fast-tracking content development and launch our first user acquisition digital marketing campaign.

 

What You Get

To say thanks to everyone who contributes to this campaign, we are offering complimentary romantic escapes at prestigious hotels in exchange for your pledges. Romantic experiences will be curated by LOVU hotels and Travel Advisor partners.

 

 

No, you do not need to be looking for a romantic getaway to pledge. The goods news is you have until 12/31/2022 to book your LOVU romantic vacay reward.  

 

LOVU's Impact

We are helping make the romantic travel industry simpler for everyone involved. Consider the benefits for each of the following groups.

CONSUMERS

 

HOTELS & RESORTS

 

TRAVEL ADVISORS 

 

Who is behind LOVU?

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute, and that's ok. We value you as a potential user of LOVU. We love that you believe in our product, and we can't wait for you to use it. To get involved, please spread the word and share our story and campaign and get people talking. While you're at it, visit our website lovu.travel, and join our email list.

We appreciate all your support, and we thank you for your time!
